column2: unary mathematical operator: successor/augment/increment (by one), $succ(a) = a++ = a+1$

mekso string operator (ternary): find-and-replace; in string/text/word/sequence X1 formally replace X2 (ordered tuple of terms to be replaced) with X3 (ordered tuple of terms to be respectively substituted)
column5: bit conjugation;bitwise binary negation;combinatorial line;digit expansion;find-and-replace
column8: X2 and X3 are ordered tuples of substrings/letters/characters/letterals/digits/numerals. The ith term in tuple X2 is replaced with the ith term in tuple X3; the replacements are executed simultaneously (thus, no overlap/contradiction can be allowed to arise in the substitution- in particular, in X2)  - alternatively, if there is overlap/conflict in/between the terms of X2, the replacements are performed in order of presentation (the ith term in X2 is replaced by the ith term in X3, and then the (i+1)th term in X2 is replaced with the (i+1)th term in X3, starting with the 1st term in each). X2 and X3 must have the same length/number of terms - alternatively, X3 cannot be longer/have more terms than X2; in this situation, the ith term of X2 is replaced with the ith term of X3 until and including when the last term of X3 is reached, after which point the remaining terms in X2 are not replaced at all. Use a permutation acting on X2 as the argument for X3 in order to rearrange the substrings of X1; if the alphabet is ordered, then operators can be applied to the letters in order to rotate through the alphabet. In particular, if X1 is a binary string (a word over an alphabet of two letters) and X2 is the 2-tuple of the letters of that binary alphabet (length-1 substrings), then without specification of X3, this operator defaults to bitwise binary negation (bit conjugation) wherein each letter in X1 is replaced by the unique other letter in the binary alphabet (otherwise, the replacement would be the identity/trivial replacement or just a formal substitution letter-by-letter which does not really change the nature of the word). X1 and each entry in X2 and X3 should be quoted, match a necessary type (such as being a character), or be abstracted a level by symbolics. In general, the replacement is formal and the strings in X3 need not be over the same alphabet as the one over which X1 is written. This operator is useful for combinatorial lines and for expanding digits (such as, in a binary string, replacing each occurrence of "0" with "01" and each occurrence of "1" with "10"; note that the replacement is instantaneous and simultaneous for all terms of X2 and every occurrence of such terms in X1, thus this substitution is perfectly acceptable).

column2: mekso operator: in ordered tuple/list/vector/sequence $X_1$, replace the $X_2$th entry with term $X_3$ of appropriate type, and leave all other entries untouched (optional: where the index for the very first/leading/header entry is $X_4$).
column8: $X_1$ must be some ordered and indexed structure; $X_2$ must be an index which specifies an entry/element/term which actually appears in $X_1$; $X_3$ is an alternative value of appropriate type which can, and after this operation does, replace the $X_2$th entry/element/term; the counting for indices is according to explicitly specified or implicit cultural convention, or the natural convention for the circumstance, or (when ambiguous or unclear) starts with 1, unless $X_4$ specifies otherwise (in which case, it is according to that specification). Exactly the $X_2$th entry is reppaced, and it is replaced with exactly $X_3$. For example: in (A, B, C), A is the $X_4$th entry (default: 1st); bai'i'i((A, B, C), 2, b, 1) = (A, b, C). $X_2$ itself could be replaced with a(n ordered) set of index values, in which case $X_3$ must be an ordered list of replacement values such that they have the same cardinality; in this situation, the $n$th index in the index set (according to its ordering) corresponds to an entry in $X_1$ which gets replaced (respectively) by the $n$th entry in $X_3$, where the entries in $X_3$ are themselves counted/indexed/ordered in the usual manner and with the first/leading/header entry being 1st unless somehow explicitly specified otherwise; the index set is automatically ordered according to the same ordering as on $X_3$ unless explicitly specified otherwise. Example: bai'i'i((A, B, C, D, E, F, G), Set(5, 2), (b, e), 1) = (A, b, C, D, e, F, G), where the ordering on $X_2$ and $X_3$ is the standard ordering starting with 1; note that Set(5, 2) is unordered and that the standard ordering rearranges it as (2, 5) with 2 being the 1st entry/element, meaning that the index 2 (corresponding with B in $X_1$) gets linked with the first entry of $X_3$, which is b, meaning that B gets replaced by b in $X_1$.

column2: Converts letterals, cmevla, or other sumti into ISO language.
preposition: outside of ...
pro-sumti: definitional terbri variable 1; $x_1$
column8: May be used to define words with {cei'e}, or to talk about definitions of existing or proposed words. Series: {bo'a} {bo'e} {bo'i} {bo'o} {bo'u}

column2: convert number into pro-sumti: definitional terbri variable with associated number; $x_n$
non-logical connective: in superposition with
column8: Useful for Schrodinger's cat, waves, interaction fields, etc. Using normal English conjunction, we say that Schrodinger's cat is both alive AND dead, but this is not exactly true: it is in a state which is the superposition of the living 'eigenstate' and the dead 'eigenstate'.

column2: pro-sumti: definitional terbri variable 2; $x_2$
column8: May be used to define words with {cei'e}, or to talk about definitions of existing or proposed words. Series: {bo'a} {bo'e} {bo'i} {bo'o} {bo'u}

column2: single Lojban-word name quote, turns to selbri-unit: "$x_1$ is that which has this name"
column8: Similar to {ze'oi}, but specifically used for names. Convenient for tanru with {brivycme} and grammars with brivla-cmevla merge, to avoid having to wrap a single word up in "{me} {la} ... {ku}".

column2: pro-sumti: definitional terbri variable 3; $x_3$
column8: May be used to define words with {cei'e}, or to talk about definitions of existing or proposed words. Series: {bo'a} {bo'e} {bo'i} {bo'o} {bo'u}

column2: unary mekso operator: immediately convert number into a single digit.
immediately convert symbolic string to number (explicit)
mekso operator/function terminator (in Polish notation): inserts exactly enough "{boi}"'s consecutively so as to terminate the most recently uttered operator/function in a mekso expression
column8: Encloses the operator and all of its explicitly mentioned operands within a pair of mekso parenthesis ({vei} and {ve'o} respectively).  All operand slots that have not already been explicitly filled are now (implicitly) filled by the default operand, {xo'ei} (which itself is taken to behave in its default mode), or the identity element under that operator/function in that position/role (in the sense that 0 or 1 is identity under exponentiation as the position/role of being the base but only 1 is identity for exponentiation in the exponent position/role).  Operators of arbitrary arity (such as {su'i}) are terminated immediately after the most recently explicitly mentioned operand. If the character string/digraph "eu" (and a corresponding diphthong) ever becomes valid in Lojban, .krtisfranks. asks that the meaning of this word be transferred wholly intact to "{boi'eu}" and that then this word be(come) unassigned.

column2: preserve formal interpretation of mekso subexpression with no substitutions made
column8: In a sense, "converts" an expression from one that has been tampered with in any way to exactly what was uttered in the first place. See: http://mw.lojban.org/papri/Proposal:_distinguishing_digits_from_numbers#Avoiding_the_.22.22D.22_Equals_.229.22.22_hole

column2: explicit "mu'o'u"-orientation marker
column8: Must be adjacent to at least one "{mu'o'u}". It 'walls off' that "mu'o'u" from applying to a quotation on the other side of this word; by the nature of "mu'o'u", this word should be elidable when two "mu'o'u"s are mutually adjacent (if this word were to be absent) or when there is no more than one quotation which is adjacent to the "mu'o'u" in question (if this word were to be absent), or when there is no "mu'o'u"; it is mandatory when it is not elidable. Example: in "lu X li'u mu'o'u lu Y li'u", it is not clear which quote (and, more specifically, which end of which quote) is being modified by "mu'o'u" - in this case, "boi'o'u" is mandatory; in "lu X li'u boi'o'u mu'o'u lu Y li'u", the "mu'o'u" applies to the quote with Y; in "lu X li'u mu'o'u boi'o'u  lu Y li'u", the "mu'o'u" applies to the quote with X; in "lu X li'u mu'o'u (boi'o'u) mu'o'u  lu Y li'u", the first "mu'o'u" applies to the quote with X, the second to the quote with Y, and this word is not necessary (marked via parenthesis).

column2: pro-sumti: definitional terbri variable 4; $x_4$
column8: May be used to define words with {cei'e}, or to talk about definitions of existing or proposed words. Series: {bo'a} {bo'e} {bo'i} {bo'o} {bo'u}

column2: attitudinal: \n{bo'oi} - silliness\n{bo'oinai} - maturity
column8: Expresses silliness, similar to one sense of ":P" (another sense being "zo'o"). What the speaker said is intended to be interpreted as being silly (not necessarily the same as humorous). Based on bebna and zo'o. See also {zo'o}, {bebna}

column2: pro-sumti: definitional terbri variable 5; $x_5$
column8: May be used to define words with {cei'e}, or to talk about definitions of existing or proposed words. Series: {bo'a} {bo'e} {bo'i} {bo'o} {bo'u}

column2: attitudinal-indicator-to-selbri conversion: $x_1$ feels the indicated emotion toward/about $x_2$.
column8: The inverse of {ki'ai}. The $x_2$ place is defined as the thing to which x1 would apply the attitudinal indicator to when using the attitudinal to express the feeling: {mi} ci'au {iu} {do} communicates much the same thing as using {do} {iu} in a bridi. See also {inmo}, {cinmo} and the {uinmo} series of zi'evla: {uinmo}, {u'inmo}, {uanmo}, etc.

column2: mekso at-most-4-ary operator: integer lattice ball; the set of all points belonging to the intersection of $Z^n$ with the closure of the ball that is centered on $X_1$ and has radius $X_2$ in metric $X_3$, where $Z$ is the set of all integers and where, for any set $A$ and non-negative integer $n$,  $A^n$ is the set of all $n$-tuples such that each coordinate/entry/term belongs to $A$, and where the dimensionality $n = X_4$..
column8: $X_3$ defaults to whatsoever metric is specified to apply but which is outside of this function; contextless default is discrete, taxicab, Euclidean, or Chebyshev maximum norm; for explicit specification, use "{mau'au}"-"{zai'ai}" quotation. $X_2$ defaults to $1$. $X_1$ defaults to $0 = (0,...,0)$, where the rhs is an $X_4$-tuple, id est the origin. See also: "{mi'i}", "{ci'au'u}".

column2: elidable terminator: end conversion of attitudinal indicator to selbri; elidable except before further attitudinals.
attitudinal: \n{ci'au'u'au'i} - pride about having just invented a new attitudinal\n{ci'au'u'au'inai} - shame about having just invented a new attitudinal
mekso operator (binary): projection function; the Bth term/entry ("element") of tuple A
column8: A must be a tuple. Let L = length(A); then L is a positive integer, 0, or infinity (countable), and  A = (A_1, A_2, ..., A_L), and B must be a natural number and belong to the ordered interval [1, L]. If L = 0, the output is a placeholder "blank element"; else, if B does not satisfy the aforementioned condition, then the function is undefined. Using the aforementioned notation, and letting Proj represent the projection function, Proj(A, B) = A_B; note that B = 1 will cause the output of the first entry in the tuple, which is A_1. For any i, there is no restriction on the typing/value of A_i so long as it is defined; the type of A_i need not even match the type of A_j for i =/= j. See also: {bai'ei}, {no'au'au}, {pi'ei}. Notice that the input is a single tuple and an integer, it does not rely on anyou underlying stucture; this is markedly different from a the dot product of vectors, although by establishing a basis and an underlying field, they can look quite similar.

column2: Converts following cmevla or zoi-quote into psychomime.
column8: Narrower term than {tai'i}. See also {ci'o}, {cinmo}, {sa'ei}, {ki'ai}. Examples in some languages. jpn: そわそわ (sowasowa): restlessly. nep: सुखदुख (sukhadukha): lit. happiness-sorrow; the human condition. eng: "zing", "yoink"

column2: $x_1$ is the Vietnamese language used by $x_2$ to express/communicate $x_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_1$ is a birch of species $x_2$
$x_1$ is a member of insect genus Bombyx [silkworms] of subtaxon/type/species/breed $x_2$
$x_1$ is a champagne made from grapes $x_2$.
column8: Cf. {vanju}, {fomvanju}, {risyvanju}, {xalka}, {koinka}.  For sparkling wines without an AOC designation, use {fomvanju}.

column2: $x_1$ is a/the triforce/Power of the Gods/Golden Triangle consisting of magic triangles $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a panda of genus/species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a buzzard of species/type $x_2$
$x_1$ is a canary.
$x_1$ is a secretarybird (bird of family Sagittariidae) of subtaxon/genus/species/breed $x_2$
$x_1$ is a stork of species/type $x_2$
$c_1$ is an ostrich/bird of genus Struthio, of species $c_2$.
$x_1$ is a hoatzin of breed $x_2$.
$x_1$ is yogurt
$x_1$ is a quantity of Parmesan/ cheese from (or similar to that from) the region of Parma and Reggio Emilia, of variety $x_2$.
tense interval modifier: thrice; objectively quantified tense; defaults as time tense.
$x_{1}$ eats/ingests/consumes (transitive verb) $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is young/youthful [relatively short in elapsed duration] by standard $x_{2}$.
column8: Also age (= {nilnalci'o}); (adjective:) $x_1$ is junior.  See also {laldo}, {cnino}, {slabu}, {verba}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a history of $x_{2}$ according to $x_{3}$ (person)/from point-of-view $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a season/is seasonal [cyclical interval], defined by interval/property $x_{2}$, of year(s) $x_{3}$.
column8: Also anniversary (= {citsydei}, {na'arcitsydei}), jubilee (= {mumnoncitsi}); the period of time may be short or long as indicated by $x_2$, and may occur every year or every nth year as indicated by $x_3$ (default every year); ($x_2$ and/or $x_3$ may need metaphorical restriction: {djecitsi}, {pavdeicitsi}; also equinox, solstice, time of year.  See also {cedra}, {crisa}, {critu}, {dunra}, {ranji}, {temci}, {vensa}, {jbena}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a louse/flea [blood-sucking arthropod] of species/breed $x_{2}$, parasitic on $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is strange/weird/deviant/bizarre/odd to $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
column8: Also alien, mysterious, deviant, queer, unusual, exotic.  See also {ranxi}, {rirci}, {fange}, {banli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of rubber/latex from source $x_{2}$ of composition including $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of coffee from source/bean/grain $x_{2}$.
column8: Brew based on a seed/bean/grain; e.g. also chicory coffee, decaf, postum. See also {tcati}, brewed from a leaf, {barja}, {cakla}.

column2: $x_{1}$ has/is characterized by property/feature/trait/aspect/dimension $x_{2}$ (ka); $x_{2}$ is manifest in $x_{1}$.
column8: Manifested/property/quality/trait/feature/aspect (= {selkai}).  See also: cmavo list {kai}, {ka}; {tcaci}, {tcini}. Need not be a defining property (which is what "characterize" means in English).

column2: $x_{1}$ is a bed/pallet of material $x_{2}$ for holding/supporting $x_{3}$ (person/object/event).
$x_{1}$ is perilous/dangerous/potentially harmful to $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
column8: $x_1$ is a danger/peril to $x_2$.  See also te {bandu}, te {kajde}, te {marbi}, se {snura}, se {xalni}.

column2: $x_{1}$ ridicules/mocks/scoffs at $x_{2}$ about $x_{3}$ (property/event) by doing activity $x_{4}$ (event).
$x_{1}$ feels ashamed/mortified/humiliated under conditions $x_{2}$ before community/audience $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (quoted word(s)) is a/the name/title/tag of $x_{2}$ to/used-by namer/name-user $x_{3}$ (person).
column8: Also: $x_2$ is called $x_1$ by $x_3$ (= selcme for reordered places).  See also cmavo list {me'e}, {gismu}, {tcita}, {valsi}, {judri}. Historically used to describe words in the Lojban morphological class allocated for use with proper nouns; this sense has been deprecated in favor of {cmevla}.

column2: $x_{1}$ laughs (emotional expression).
$x_{1}$ is a member/element of set $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ belongs to group $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is amid/among/amongst group $x_{2}$.
column8: $x_1$ may be a complete or incomplete list of members; $x_2$ is normally marked by la'i/le'i/lo'i, defining the set in terms of its common property(ies), though it may be a complete enumeration of the membership.  See also {ciste}, {porsi}, {jbini}, {girzu}, {gunma}, {klesi}, cmavo list {mei}, {kampu}, {lanzu}, {liste}.

column2: $x_{1}$ utters moan/groan/howl/scream [non-linguistic utterance] $x_{2}$ expressing $x_{3}$ (property).
column8: Also shriek, most animal sounds, e.g. bark, cackle, meow, neigh, moo, honk, baa, crow. See also {krixa}, {bacru}, {cusku}, {cortu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ [value] is a norm/average in property/amount $x_{2}$ (ka/ni) among $x_{3}$(s) (set) by standard $x_{4}$.
column8: Also mean, normal, usual; ($x_3$ specifies the complete set).  See also {tcaci}, {fadni}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tarti}, {rirci}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the neck [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: a relatively narrow point].
$x_{1}$ (agent) rewards $x_{2}$ [recipient] for atypical $x_{3}$ (event/property) with reward/desserts $x_{4}$.
column8: Differs from earned payment because of atypical nature; rewards need not be positive but are in some sense deserved from the point of view of the rewarder: positive reward (= {zanyne'u}), punishment, penalty, demerit (= {malne'u}, {sfane'u}); $x_4$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posne'u}, {posyvelne'u} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {dunda}, {friti}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jivna}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {venfu}, {prali}, {dapma}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is orderly/neat/ordered in property/quantity $x_{2}$ (ka/ni).
$x_{1}$ is new/unfamiliar/novel to observer $x_{2}$ in feature $x_{3}$ (ka) by standard $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is a novelty.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of lead (Pb); [metaphor: heavy, malleable, soft metal].
$x_{1}$ is directly/vertically beneath/below/under/underneath/down from $x_{2}$ in frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ soaks up/absorbs/sucks up $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ into $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is an absorbant.
$x_{1}$ is deep in extent in direction/property $x_{2}$ away from reference point $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ hurts/feels pain/hurt at locus $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ gets/procures/acquires/obtains/accepts $x_{2}$ from source $x_{3}$ [previous possessor not implied].
column8: Also fetch; accept a gift (= {seldu'acpa}).  See also {punji}, {lebna}, {vimcu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is upon/atop/resting on/lying on [the upper surface of] $x_{2}$ in frame of reference/gravity $x_{3}$.
column8: ($x_1$ may be object or event); See also se {vasru}, {jbini}, {zvati}, {nenri}, {vreta}, {ckana}, {diklo}, {jibni}, {lamji}, {zutse}, {punji} for lay upon, {sarji}, {zbepi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ climbs/clambers/creeps/crawls on surface $x_{2}$ in direction $x_{3}$ using $x_{4}$ [limbs/tools].
$x_{1}$ requests/asks/petitions/solicits for $x_{2}$ of/from $x_{3}$ in manner/form $x_{4}$.
column8: Also demand (= {mi'ecpe}); $x_4$ is a means of expression See also ve {cusku}.: a request may be indicated in speech, in writing, or by an action (e.g. petitions are often in writing, while begging/panhandling may be indicated by an action or even demeanor).  (cf. {pikci}, te {preti}, te {frati}, se {spuda}, {danfu})

column2: $x_{1}$ is pungent/piquant/peppery/spicy/irritating to sense $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ broadcasts/transmits [using radio waves] $x_{2}$ via station/frequency $x_{3}$ to [radio] receiver $x_{4}$.
column8: Also $x_1$ is a broadcaster.  See also {tivni}, {benji}, {tcana}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is anterior/ahead/forward/(in/on) the front of $x_{2}$ which faces/in-frame-of-reference $x_{3}$.
column8: Also: $x_3$ is the standard of orientation for $x_2$. See also {sefta}, {flira}, {trixe}, {mlana}, {pritu}, {zunle}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a shirt/blouse/top [upper-body garment - not necessarily sleeved or buttoned], material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) harvests/reaps/gathers crop/product/objects $x_{2}$ from source/area $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bear/ursoid of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fairy/elf/gnome/brownie/pixie/goblin/kobold [mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion $x_{2}$.
column8: Also orc, giant, demon or devil (when humanoid-form is presumed by the mythos/religion), bugbear, bogeyman.  (cf. {ranmi}, especially for non-humanoid creatures of myth, {lijda})

column2: $x_{1}$ is green/verdant [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is a bridge/span over/across $x_{2}$ between $x_{3}$ and $x_{4}$ [unordered, typically destination first].
$x_{1}$ is summer/summertime [hot season] of year $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is autumn/fall [harvest/cooling season] of year $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a tide [cyclical/periodic expansion] in $x_{2}$ caused by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the lip [body-part]/rim of orifice $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is labial.
$x_{1}$ is a tax/levy/duty on goods/services/event $x_{2}$ levied against $x_{3}$ by authority/collector $x_{4}$.
column8: Also custom, toll, tariff, tribute. See also {pleji}, {flalu}, {turni}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of petroleum/oil from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shadow/the shade of object $x_{2}$, made by light/energy source $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ teaches audience $x_{2}$ ideas/methods/lore $x_{3}$ (du'u) about subject(s) $x_{4}$ by method $x_{5}$ (event).
column8: Also instruct, instructor, educate, educator, teacher, professor, pedagogue; (adjective:) $x_1$/$x_5$ is pedagogical.  See also {ckule}, {cilre}, {tadni}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is round/circular [2-dimensional shape/form]; $x_{1}$ is a disk/circle/ring.
column8: Normally used for a filled-in circle/disk, but emphasis on roundness means that the concept may include 'ring'.  See also {djine}, {ranji}, {bolci}, {tarmi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a book containing work $x_{2}$ by author $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$ preserved in medium $x_{5}$.
column8: $x_1$ is a copy/manifestation/container (a physical object or its analogue) of a literary work [$x_2$], not necessarily using paper (= {selpapri}). See also {cfika}, {prina}, {prosa}, {tcidu}, {papri}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is full/completely filled with $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state/property) is possible under conditions $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ may/might occur; $x_{1}$ is a maybe.
$x_{1}$ is humble/modest about $x_{2}$ (abstraction); $x_{1}$ displays humility about $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of millet [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is random/fortuitous/unpredictable under conditions $x_{2}$, with probability distribution $x_{3}$.
column8: Also accidental, chancy, by chance, adventitious, arbitrary (also = {cuncu'a}, {cunselcu'a}, {cunjdi}, {cunseljdi}; based on "unpredictable").  See also {cnici}, {lakne}, {funca}, {kalsa}, {snuti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is an affair/organized activity involving person(s) $x_{2}$ (ind./mass); $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$'s business.
column8: Also matter, concern; $x_2$ is engaged in $x_1$ (which is usually an abstraction) (= {selcu'u} for reordered places). See also {jikca}, {srana}.

column2: $x_{1}$ produces $x_{2}$ [product] by process $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) lets/permits/allows $x_{2}$ (event) under conditions $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ grants privilege $x_{2}$.
column8: Sufficient condition (= {crutcini}), agent that permits a situation (= {tcinycru}).  See also {rinju}, {banzu}, {ralte}, {jimte}, {jaspu}, {zifre}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a worm/invertebrate animal of species/breed $x_{2}$.
column8: Also mollusk, snail (= {cakcurnu}), shellfish (= {xaskemcakcurnu}, {xaskemcakydja}); the generalization to invertebrate is because many multicellular invertebrates are indeed wormlike.  See also {since}, {silka}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is pure/unadulterated/unmitigated/simple in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ (agent) expresses/says $x_{2}$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $x_{3}$ via expressive medium $x_{4}$.
column8: Also says.  See also {bacru}, {tavla}, {casnu}, {spuda}, cmavo list {cu'u}, {bangu}, {dapma}, {jufra}, {pinka}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a shoe/boot/sandal for covering/protecting [feet/hooves] $x_{2}$, and of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the chest/thorax/upper trunk/[rib cage/breast] [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ chooses/selects $x_{2}$ [choice] from set/sequence of alternatives $x_{3}$ (complete set).
$x_{1}$ is a knife (tool) for cutting $x_{2}$, with blade of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a sack/bag with contents $x_{2}$, and of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ fights/combats/struggles with $x_{2}$ over issue $x_{3}$ (abstract); $x_{1}$ is a fighter/combatant.
column8: Use $x_3$ tu'a for fight over an object/objective.  See also {bradi}, {gunta}, {talsa}, {darlu}, {fapro}, {jamna}, {sonci}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a drum/cymbal/gong [percussion musical instrument] with beater/actuator $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ hangs/dangles/is suspended from $x_{2}$ by/at/with joint $x_{3}$.
column8: Pendant (= {dadja'i}); also dependent (original meaning). See also {lasna}, {jorne}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is the answer/response/solution/[reply] to question/problem $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an animal/creature of species $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is biologically animate.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of smoke/smog/air pollution from source $x_{2}$.
column8: $x_2$ may be a fire.  See also {pulce}, {gapci}, {sigja}, {bumru}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (force) puts pressure on/presses/applies force to $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (individual, mass) dances to accompaniment/music/rhythm $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a ballistic projectile [e.g. bullet/missile] for firing by [gun/propelling launcher] $x_{2}$.
column8: Also cannonball, catapult stone, shot pellet(s).  See also {cecla}, {renro}, {jakne}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is an island/atoll/key of [material/properties] $x_{2}$ in surroundings/body $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is insular.
$x_{1}$ curses/damns/condemns $x_{2}$ to fate (event) $x_{3}$.
column8: Curse with a specific expression (= {dapsku}).  See also {mabla}, {dimna}, {cnemu}, {sfasa}, {dunda}, {cusku}, {cirko}, {jdima}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a road/highway to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ with route $x_{4}$ ($x_{2}$/$x_{3}$ may be unordered).
column8: A regularly used, improved-for-use surface for travelling.  See also {naxle}, {tcana}, {pluta}, {klaji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ argues for stand $x_{2}$ against stand $x_{3}$; [an opponent is not necessary].
$x_{1}$ is far/distant from $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ shows audacity/chutzpah in behavior $x_{2}$ (event/activity); $x_{1}$ dares to do/be $x_{2}$ (event/ka).
$x_{1}$ hits/strikes/[beats] $x_{2}$ with instrument [or body-part] $x_{3}$ at locus $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a pocket/pouch of/in garment/item $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ wears/is robed/garbed in $x_{2}$ as a garment of type $x_{3}$.
column8: $x_2$ need not be intended for use as a garment (unlike taxfu).  See also {taxfu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event) destroys/ruins/wrecks/despoils $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is destructive.
$x_{1}$ is a ribbon/tape/strip/band/stripe of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a duck/[drake] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (du'u) [fact/measurement] is data/information/statistic(s) about $x_{2}$ gathered by method $x_{3}$.
column8: Evidence (= velji'i datni or just {velji'i}, {sidydatni}). See also {fatci}, {saske}, {vreji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a tenth [1/10; $10^{-1}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
column8: (cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the finger/digit/toe [body-part] on limb/body site $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$; [metaphor: peninsula].
$x_{1}$ owes $x_{2}$ in debt/obligation to creditor $x_{3}$ in return for $x_{4}$ [service, loan]; $x_{1}$ is a debtor.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (default 1) local volume unit(s) [non-metric; e.g. bushel], standard $x_{3}$, $x_{4}$ subunits.
column8: Gallon (= {likydekpu}), quart (= {likseldekpu}), barrel (wet = likybradekpu, dry = sudbradekpu), bushel (= {sudydekpu}), peck (= {sudyseldekpu}), cupful (= {kabrydekpu}), tablespoon (= {mucydekpu}); teaspoon (= {mucyxeldekpu}); (all of these lujvo may need gic- to distinguish the English measurement system in contrasting with some local system; the English system is otherwise presumed to be the default non-metric system).  (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {canlu}, {litce}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is ten [10; $10^1$ ] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ candela [metric unit] in luminosity (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bean/pea/leguminous seed from plant [legume] $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the tooth [body-part] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is dental.
$x_{1}$ is dense/concentrated/packed/intense in property $x_{2}$ (ka) at location/locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ awaits/waits/pauses for/until $x_{2}$ at state $x_{3}$ before starting/continuing $x_{4}$ (activity/process).
column8: ($x_2$ is an event, usually a point event); also: resuming $x_4$.  See also {dicra}, {fanmo}, {sisti}, {fliba}, {pandi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of dirt/soil/earth/ground from source $x_{2}$ of composition $x_{3}$.
column8: Also: $x_1$ is earthen; $x_3$: composition including $x_3$, which need not be exhaustive of composition.  See also {kliti}, {terdi}, {loldi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a heap/pile/stack/mound/hill of materials $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ shakes/quakes/trembles/quivers/shudders/wobbles/vibrates from force $x_{2}$.
column8: Also (expressible either with desku or slilu): side to side, to and fro, back and forth, reciprocal motion.  See also {slilu}, {janbe}.

column2: $x_1$ is the date [day,{week},{month},year] of event/state $x_2$, at location $x_3$, by calendar $x_4$.
column8: Time units in x1 are specified as numbers separated by pi'e, starting from the smallest time unit, or are unit values massified with joi. Alternatively, the time units in x1 are specified as numbers prefixed by {ny} for years, {ly} for months, {dy} for days, {cy} for hours, {my} for minutes, and {sy} for seconds, and in this scheme, any time unit may be left out. Cf. {de'i}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {masti}, {nanca}, {tcika}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event) interrupts/stops/halts/[disrupts] $x_{2}$ (object/event/process) due to quality $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is electricity [electric charge or current] in/on $x_{2}$ of polarity/quantity $x_{3}$ (def. negative).
column8: ($x_3$, a quantifier, can be expressed as a simple polarity using the numerals for positive and negative ma'u and ni'u); (explicitly) negative (= {dutydikca}), positive (= {mardikca}); current (= {selmuvdikca}, {muvdikca}; again default negative/electron current), charge (= {klodikca}, {stadikca}).  See also {lindi}, {xampo}, {flecu}, {maksi}, {tcana}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is local to $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is confined to locus $x_{2}$ within range $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is regional
column8: Indicates a specific location/value within a range; e.g. a hits b.  What is the locality on b that a hits?  Thus $x_1$ is associated with a specific narrow region/interval $x_2$ of wider space/range $x_3$.  See also cmavo list {di'o}, {jibni}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {nenri}, {lamji}, {stuzi}, {tcila}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is regular/cyclical/periodic in property (ka)/activity $x_{2}$ with period/interval $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quotient of '$x_{2}$/$x_{3}$' [dividend $x_{2}$ divided by divisor $x_{3}$], leaving remainder $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cloud/mass of clouds of material $x_{2}$ in air mass $x_{3}$ at floor/base elevation $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fate/destiny of $x_{2}$; [doom, curse are mabla-forms]; $x_{2}$ is fated/predestined/doomed to $x_{1}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ full days in duration (default is 1 day) by standard $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is diurnal.
$x_{1}$ desires/wants/wishes $x_{2}$ (event/state) for purpose $x_{3}$.
column8: If desire is for an object, this is sumti-raising; use tu'a in $x_2$ (or use lujvo = {po'edji}).  See also {taske}, {xagji}, {mukti}, {nitcu}, {nelci}, {pacna}, {prami}, {rigni}, {trina}, {xebni}, {xlura}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a ring/annulus/torus/circle [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, inside diam. $x_{3}$, outside diam. $x_{4}$.
column8: Also ellipse, oval (= {jincla}); (usage has been for near-circles, such as tight spirals, even if not closed loops).  Also band, belt, encircle (= {jinsru}).  See also {clupa}, {cukla}, {dasri}, {karli}, {sovda}, {sruri}, {konju}.

column2: $x_{1}$ knows fact(s) $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$ by epistemology $x_{4}$.
column8: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place; know how to - implying knowledge of method but not necessarily having the ability to practice (= {tadjyju'o}). 'know/familiar with' - {se} {slabu}, {na'e} {cnino}, {na'e} {fange}. See also {du'o}, {krici}, {jinvi}, {cilre}, {certu}, {facki}, {jijnu}, {jimpe}, {senpi}, {smadi}, {kakne}, {birti}, {mipri}, {morji}, {saske}, {viska}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is the daytime of day $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is diurnal (vs. nocturnal).
$x_{1}$ reflects German/Germanic culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a drama/play about $x_{2}$ [plot/theme/subject] by dramatist $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$ with actors $x_{5}$.
column8: $x_2$ may also be a convention. See also {finti}, {cukta}, {lisri}, {cfika}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is correct/proper/right/perfect in property/aspect $x_{2}$ (ka) in situation $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ isn't the-same-thing-as/is different-from/other-than $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is something else.
$x_{1}$ is a roof/top/ceiling/lid of $x_{2}$.
column8: (cf. {bitmu}, {stedu}, {galtu}, {gapru}, {loldi}, {marbi}, {gacri}, {mapku}; a drudi is (designed to be) over/above something and shelters it from other things above the drudi, mapku)

column2: $x_{1}$ is the logarithm of $x_{2}$ with base $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an elder/ancestor of $x_{2}$ by bond/tie/degree $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$'s generation precedes $x_{2}$'s parents.
$x_{1}$ reflects Antarctican culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
{ckilu} modal, 1st place                            on the scale ...
tanru inversion operator; "... of type ..."; allows modifier trailing sumti without sumti links.
interval event contour: at the starting point of ...; initiative                   >|<    |.
elliptical/unspecified bridi relationship.
interval event contour: at the instantaneous point of ...; achievative/perfective; point event   >|<.
vocative: greetings/hello.
vocative: partings/good-bye.
interval event contour: at the ending point of ... even if not done; cessative      |  >< |.
elidable marker: separates selbri from preceding sumti, allows preceding terminator elision.
unary mathematical operator: absolute value/norm  |a|.
tense/modal question.
attitudinal: neutral scalar attitude modifier.
convert number to probability selbri; event $x_{1}$ has probability (n) of occurring under cond. $x_{2}$.
{cusku} modal, 1st place (attribution/quotation)    as said by source ...; used for quotation.
discursive: \n{da'i} - supposing\n{da'inai} - in fact.
attitudinal modifier: marks empathetic use of preceding attitudinal; shows another's feelings.
discursive: cancel pro-sumti/pro-bridi assignments.
pro-sumti: a remote past utterance; "She couldn't have known that IT would be true.".
digit/number: hex digit A (decimal 10) [ten].
logically quantified existential pro-sumti: there exists something 2 (usually restricted).
event contour for a temporary halt and ensuing pause in a process.
pro-sumti: a near future utterance.
{detri} modal, 1st place: on date/dated ... ; attaches date and/or time.
column8: Time units in the following date/time are specified as numbers separated by pi'e, starting from the smallest time unit, or are unit values massified with joi. Alternatively, the time units in x1 are specified as numbers prefixed by {ny} for years, {ly} for months, {dy} for days, {cy} for hours, {my} for minutes, and {sy} for seconds, and in this scheme, any time unit may be left out. Cf. {detri}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {masti}, {nanca}, {tcika}.

column2: pro-sumti: this utterance.
binary mathematical operator: logarithm; [log/ln a to base b]; default base 10 or e.
pro-sumti: a recent utterance.
logically quantified existential pro-sumti: there exists something 3 (usually restricted).
pro-sumti: the next utterance.
tense interval modifier: regularly; subjective tense/modal; defaults as time tense.
pro-sumti: you listener(s); identified by vocative.
discursive: \n{do'a} - generously\n{do'anai} - parsimoniously.
elliptical/unspecified modal.
pro-sumti: elliptical/unspecified utterance variable.
generic vocative marker; identifies intended listener; elidable after COI.
pro-sumti: you the listener & others unspecified.
elidable terminator: end vocative (often elidable).
identity selbri; = sign; $x_{1}$ identically equals $x_{2}$, $x_{3}$, etc.; attached sumti refer to same thing.
location tense relation/direction; east of.
digit/number: too many; subjective.
{dunli} modal, 1st place (equalled by)              equally; as much as ...
logical connective: sumti afterthought and.
attitudinal: \n{e'a} - granting permission\n{e'anai} - prohibiting.
attitudinal: \n{e'e} - competence\n{e'enai} - incompetence/inability.

attitudinal: 
{e'i} - feeling constraint
{e'icu'i} - independence
{e'inai} - challenge/resistance against constraint.
attitudinal: \n{ei} - obligation\n{einai} - freedom.

$x_1$ is meta to/an example of $x_2$ that describes such an object/concept/notion/system/topic/etc., being meta in property/aspect $x_3$, and which has features $x_4$, governed by/considered in system/considerations/epistemology/theory $x_5$; $x_1$ is meta (a particular type of abstraction of $x_2$ so as to apply to itself in some sense); $x_1$ is an/a piece of/an example of $x_2$ that applies fractally thereto
column8: Does not (necessarily) mean "beyond", "after", "beside"; in some (rather pictoral) senses, these meanings may be necessary but not sufficient for being meta in this sense; thus, "metaphysics" should not be translated using this word. x1 is an object, notion, topic, system, etc. which applies to x2 but which is itself an example thereof; for example, the meanings of the words "metalinguistics" and "metadata" are meta in this sense. It is not necessarily directly self-referential, but could be fractally applicative. x1 is an X that is about (another) X; x1 is an abstraction of X so as to apply to X. x1 does not necessarily abstract [from] (in one sense), but is abstract to, x2. See also: {xulta} (generalized/weaker), {sucta}.

column2: $x_1$ is a morphologically defined name word meaning $x_2$ in language $x_3$.
column8: (By analogy with {brivo}; syn. {cmevla}) In Lojban, such words are characterized by ending with a consonant. In Lojban, a {cmevo} may only consist of a single word, whereas a {cmene} can consist of one or multiple words, which may be cmevo. See also {vlaturge'a}.

column2: $x_1$ empathizes with $x_2$, showing same emotion $x_3$ about $x_4$
column8: A gismu for a very important concept that, for some reason, didn't find its way into the gimste. See {cinmo}, {dai}, {dunli}.

column2: $x_1$ is a plum/member of subgenus Prunus of genus Prunus of species/variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is functional / usable for function $x_2$

$x_1$ is a gesture/facial expression/body part motion/body language/expressive (nonverbal or nonvocal) feature/microexpression/stature/posture/sign/body signal [nonverbal expression made using only one's body parts and items on one's immediate person as extensions of the body in order to communicate; possibly nonlinguistic/extralinguistic] that conveys/expresses thought/emotion/command/idea $x_2$ (nu/si'o; possibly text and other types) made using body part/utensil/object/at locus $x_3$ in/by motion/action/means $x_4$
column8: Must be body-oriented; any other object involved is simply for the matter of convenience and acts as an extension of the body (and thus must be on the performer's immediate person at or near the locus of the gesture). Body language, posturing, and stature are usually considered to be nonlocalized (body-general), although they need not be (and technically are not in general). Must be externally visible and/or internally sensed. Any non-body-part utensil/item (including clothing) must function as an extension of the body in the gesture. Need not be conscious or performed by a person (note that agent/performer is not mentioned in this definition); can, but need not, be accompanied by vocalizations (not necessarily linguistic), but the gesture itself is not primarily noise-producing. Might include sign language words or cheremes, although a more explicit word for linguistically organized and “full” cheremes is preferred (and especially for the sign language as a whole). x1 is possibly best typed by {nu} and/or {si'o}. x4 might be best expressed as an event; for example, it could be "the event of the right hand touching the chest near the heart, with fist clenched" for a salute, whereas/wherein x3 would be merely the fist/hand (and the chest near the heart). Use "{cocygau}" resp. "{cocyzu'e}" for: "$x_1$ (agent resp. volitional entity) gestures; $x1$ agentively/actively makes gesture $x2$, communicating $x3$, performed with body part(s) $x4$ in motion $x5$"; this lujvo uses an unofficial cmarafsi. Proposed short rafsi: -coc-.

column2: $x_1$ appears
$x_1$ is a mythological/fantastic creature [mythical organism] of mythos/religion/story/culture $x_2$.
column5: mythological animal;mythological automaton;mythological fungus;mythological organism;mythological plant
column8: Need not be an animal, nor even active, but must be alive/active/animate (includes ghosts, spirits, genies, golems, etc.). The reference set of this word is a strict superset of the reference set of "{crida}".  See also: "{ranmi}".

column2: $x_1$ reflects/relates to/pertains to CLL (Lojbanic) grammatical standards in manner/aspect $x_2$, specific to version $x_3$ (contextless default: the most recent version that has been officially accepted by the Lojban language's governing body (presently, the BPFK))
$x_1$ is an arthropod; $x_1$ is a bug (broad sense)
column8: For a world in which {cinki} means "insect" or "hexapod". The source words for {cinki} mean "insect", so I prefer narrowing its meaning and adding a new word for "arthropod" based on more fitting source words. See also {lokra}, {jukni}, {sortu'e}

column2: $x_1$ (scalar-valued) is the norm/magnitude/size of concrete (and specific) mathematical object $x_2$ in norm space/according to metric (if relevant)/by definition/of type $x_3$
$x_1$ is okay/alright/acceptable to $x_2$ by standard $x_3$
$x_1$ is careful/cautious in $x_2$ (ka)
$x_1$ is the spacial interval/geodesic segment (or line segment/ray/line) from location/point $x_2$ to location/point $x_3$ in geometry/frame of reference $x_4$.
column8: Like "{temci}", but for space. "{nicfa}" yields a vector which encodes similar information (when projected into space). $x_4$ can be used, for example, in order to determine whether $x_1$ lies across the Earth's surface or cuts through the Earth (like a tunnel) for two distinct city centers. Like "temci", it is essentially just "{sirji}", but specifically designed in order to pertain to a given measurement-dimension (namely, in this case, space).

column2: $x_1$ arrives at $x_2$ via route $x_3$
$x_1$ is the standard by which $x_2$ (abstraction) is true
column8: {fi'o} {dardu} {fe'u} is the beloved "by standard", which currently has no modal on its own.

column2: $x_1$ examines/checks/investigates $x_2$ for $x_3$ (ka/ni)
column8: Also survey, probe, research. Note that x2 can be either an object or an abstraction/general topic of consideration. See also {facki}, {sisku}, {tadni}.

column2: $x_1$ (event) is dated/pertaining to day/occurring on day $x_2$ of month $x_3$ of year $x_4$ in calendar $x_5$
column8: Moved from {datru} due to conflict with {tatru}. We felt that {detri} just didn't work as a culturally-independent date system. The use of {pi'e} or {joi} as date mechanisms was insufficient and having the date components built into the place structure seems far more elegant. (Cf. {masti}, {djedi}, {nanca}, {nu}, {fasnu}, {purci}, {balvi}, {jeftu})

column2: $x_1$ (amount/value (li/ni) or labelled entity) is the (mutual) difference between/change in (states/realizations of/output from) general and relevant idea/object or subject of interest or function/aspect/property/topic/dependent parameter/dependent variable $x_2$ under or due to a change in (independent) parameter/variable/index/identification/ownership/property/aspect $x_3$ (generic name) to (later) specific state/realization/value/person/entity/meaning $x_4$ (type and dimensions match those of $x_3$) from (earlier) specific state/realization/value/person/entity/meaning $x_5$ (type and dimensions match that of $x_3$), under circumstances/conditions/with(in) scope/with caveats $x_6$.
column8: Especially in reference to incremental or quantized (or discretely observed) changes. $x_2$ is an $x_1$-type-valued function of $x_3$; $x_4$ and $x_5$ are realizations of $x_3$ (therefore, all three share type). For example, $x_1$ could be some value with dimensions of currency/money/monetary value measured in real numbers, $x_2$ could be a specific business' profit from certain sales, $x_3$ may be time (so, $x_2$ would be the profit over time, measured in a real number of units of currency), and $x_4$ and $x_5$ would be specific times - such as today and yesterday, respectively. Ideally, all factors, variables, conditions, etc. other than $x_3$ should remain constant or there should be a control group/population which records the effects of changes in other factors, variables, conditions, etc.; however, in real life, things can be more complicated or messy and it is hard to ensure that all factors are accounted for (especially in social experiments and business); $x_5$ records those other conditions or specifies the scope (for example: subjects, time, and location) of the 'experiment'. Typically, $x_4$ will be temporally later than $x_5$, but this need not be the case; in any case, $x_4$ is taken to be the latter state (etc.) under consideration in the present analysis in the context of this word's usage (in some sequence). $x_1$ could be "0" (whatsoever that means) - it could even be identically so; in other words, there need be no change or mutual difference, even in principle (the function/object could be constant); and this fact could even be known a priori. See also: "{sumji}" / "{selsumji}".

column2: $x_1$ deduces/reasons by deduction/establishes by deduction that $x_2$ is true about $x_3$ from general rule $x_4$

$x_1$ is aligned diagonally along/between nonadjacent vertices $x_2$ as in polytope $x_3$; $x_1$ is a diagonal line segment/linear manifold of lower dimension as viewed in frame of reference $x_3$; $x_1$ is crooked (one sense), skew (one sense, see notes), off-kilter (one sense), away from center/off-center, non-orthogonal/not perpendicular nor parallel, at an angle, perhaps non-vertical and non-horizontal, diagonal to $x_2$ in figure/coordinate system $x_3$.
column8: Not for use in: entries of tensors/matrices (confer: {daigno}), certain geometric meanings (such as with Cartesian products), etc.  Only for purely 'visual' geometric objects/figures/frames. The polytope in question need not actually be 'drawn'; an oriented frame of reference naturally 'projects' a polytopic sense onto all objects. x1 can be any linear manifold of lower dimension than the space in which it is embedded (defined by x3). The skewness is not relative to another linear manifold in some higher-dimensional space (the usual definition of "skew" in geometry) - it is simply a skewness (in a layperson sense) relative to points in a figure or axis in a coordinate system. Proposed by Gleki.

column2: $x_1$ belongs to conjugacy class $x_2$ in structure $x_3$ under conditions $x_4$

$x_1$ is a non-binary/intersex (probably also can include: asexual, nongendered, indeterminately gendered) individual of species $x_2$ evidencing non-binary gender trait(s) $x_3$ (ka); $x_1$ is characterized by not following or fitting into some gender-binary.
$x_1$ wants to do $x_2$ (property of $x_1$)
column8: Based off of {djica} and {ka}.  See also {djica}

column2: $x_1$ is a (topological) hole in object $x_2$
column8: Refers to a "hole" in the topological sense, i.e. one which goes all the way through an object, such as a hole in a sheet of paper. For non-topological holes (ones that do not go all the way through, such as a hole in the ground), use {kevna}. See also {canko}, {kalri}, {canlu}. Proposed rafsi -dol-

column2: $x1$ is medicine used to treat illness/disease $x2$ ({bilma}/ka/state) via mechanism of action $x3$ (event) at dosage $x4$ (ka))
column8: x1 is medicinal.  x4 is properly a period and an amount, e.g. "loka {milgra} li panono {reroi} ro le {djedi}", but may be abbreviated to either. See also {mikce}, {micyxu'i}, {farmako}, {bilma} Made with gismu[...]score.py iau ocydi dryg medisina lekarstvo daua

column2: $x_1$ is a binary operator in space/under conditions/on (or endowing) set $x_2$ such that there is an identity element and for any element for which it is defined in the space (excepting possibly a small number of special elements), there exists at least one element also in the space which is a left-inverse of that element under the operator.
column5: operator with inverses of inputs;space with inverse elements
column8: This presupposes {sezni}. This does not say that the operator has an inverse, merely that each element does under the operator (these properties are closely related though). See also: {socni}, {sezni}, {cajni}, {facni}.

column2: $x_1$ is recursively related to $x_2$ by applying $x_3$ (number) levels-of-recursion of the predicate-relation $x_4$ (ka with two ce'u)
column8: Rafsi -dzo- (when -dzo- is a tertau then seltau corresponds to $x_4$ of {dzoli}). Synonym of {refkusi} for more convenience in making lujvo. tanru example for common usage: 'the day three days from now (tomorrow's tomorrow's tomorrow)' is '{le} {bavlamdeidzo} {be} {fi} {li} {ci}'. Cf. {krefu}, {rapli}, {dzoli}.

column2: $b_1$=$f_1$=$c_1$ is a heifer [young female bovine/cow] of species/breed $b_2$=$f_2$ by standard $f_3$=$c_2$.
$k_1$ is a kid of goat species $k_2$.
$x_1$ eats another which eats another which ... which eats another which eats $x_2$ via intermediate steps $x_3$ (ce'o).
$z_1$=$c_1$ is younger than $z_2$ by amount $z_4$.
$m_1$=$c_1$ is a younger sister of $m_2$
$m_1$ is a young cat/kitten [feline animal] of species/breed $m_2$; (adjective:) $m_1$ is a young feline.
$m_1$ is cute to $m_2$ in aspect $m_3$.
$n_1$=$c_1$ is a youth/young man by standard $c_2$.
$p_1$ has a crush on/is infatuated with $p_2$
$t_1$=$c_1$ is youngest among $t_4$.
$x_1$  is a scallion/green onions/spring onions/salad onions/green shallots/onions having hollow green leaves and lacking a fully developed root bulb (genus Allium) of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a monsoon
$x_1$ migrates to $x_2$ from $x_3$ over path/route $x_4$ in season $x_5$.
$r_1$ is a quantity of/contains veal/bovine meat/flesh from young bovine/cattle $c_2$=$b_1$=$c_1$.
$g_1$ is a young dog/canine/[bitch]/puppy of species/breed $g_2$.
$t_1$=$c_1$ is an embryo ( a multicellular diploid eukaryote in its earliest stage of development)  with mother $t_2$ and father $t_3$.
$x_1$ is a louse-fly of species $x_2$.
$x_1$=$c_1$=$d_1$ is a monster/freak of species $x_2$=$d_2$, monstrous/freakish in property $x_4$=$c_3$ according to $x_3$=$c_4$.
$x_1$ is stranger than $x_2$ to $x_3$ in aspect $x_4$ (ka), by a margin $x_5$.
$x_1$ is less strange than $x_2$ to $x_3$ in aspect $x_4$ (ka), by a margin $x_5$.
$x_1$ dislikes $x_2$ because $x_1$ finds that $x_2$ is weird in property $x_3$.
$b_1$ is a bed sheet of material $b_2$.
$b_1$ is bedcloth of material $b_2$.
$d_1$=$cl_1$=$ck_1$ is a rubber band.
$x_1$ is a bedbug.
$x_1$ is a blanket / quilt.
$k_1$ goes to bed from $k_3$.
$cl_1$ rises/gets up/leaves bed.
$xi_1$=$c_1$ is a pony of species/breed $xi_2$.
$z_1$ is a hut of/for $z_1$, small as compared with standard/norm $c_3$.
$z_1$=$c_1$ shrinks/decreases in property $c_2$ (ka) by amount $z_3$.
$g_1$ causes $z_1$=$c_1$ to decrease in property/dimension $b_2$ (ka) by amount $z_3$.
$x_1$ is claustrophobic.
column8: Claustrophobia is a fear of small enclosed spaces. See also {noryraclyte'a}.

column2: $x_1$ is a small zevla meaning $x_2$.
column8: This word uses the experimental rafsi "-zve-" for the experimental gismu "{zevla}". This word is mostly intended for {zevla} which imitate {gismu}, such as "{raunte} for "{ronte}" or hypothetical "{gro'oxe}", perhaps "{xlei'eva}", etc. The boundaries of this category are fuzzy.

column2: $b_1$ is a pseudonym/pronoun, replacing real name $b_2$=$c_1$ of $x_3$=$c_2$ in circumstance $x_4$=$b_3$.
$x_1$ is anonymous to $x_2$; $x_1$ lacks a name to system/person $x_2$

$ci_1$ (mass) is a nomenclature/system of names interrelated by nomenclature rules $ci_2$ among names/terms $cm_1$=$ci_3$ (set (of quoted words)), used by $cm_3$ (person(s)) with systemic functions/properties $ci_4$ (ka).
$c_1$ (si'o) is a nominal scale of units [names and/or (meta-)categories and other qualitative classifications] for measuring/observing/determining $c_2$ (state).
$s_1$ identifies $s_2$=$c_2$ by name $c_1$ used-by namer/name-user $c_3$ (person).
$s_1$ is onomastics/onomatology of/about names $j_1$=$s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
$l_1$ is an onomasticon of names $l_2$=$c_1$ in order $l_3$ in medium $l_4$.
$t_1$ is a name tag/nameplate of $t_2$=$c_2$ showing text $c_1$.
$g_1$=$v_3$ registers $c_2$ with user-name $c_1$ on system/application $c_3$.
$x_1$ is a morphologically defined name word meaning $x_2$ in language $x_3$.
column8: In Lojban, such words are characterized by ending with a consonant. In Lojban, a {cmevla} may only consist of a single word, whereas a {cmene} can consist of one or multiple words, which may be cmevla. See also {vlaturge'a}.

column2: $x_1$ is a cmevla-based name for $x_2$ used by namer $x_3$
$b_1$=$c_1$ becomes a member of group $b_2$=$c_2$ under conditions $b_3$.
$x_1$ is a set with many members; $x_1$ is a set with a great cardinality.
$cm_1$=$cu_1$ votes for $cu_2$ among choices $cu_3$ in voting group $cm_2$.
column8: Applies to any election, not just public ones. Cf. {turni}.

column2: $k_1$ is suffrage entitled to $k_2$=$cu_1$ by standard $k_3$.
column8: It is a civil right, {selcemkrali}. Cf. {cmicu'a}.

column2: $g_1$ puts together $c_1$ into group $c_2$.
$x_1$ (collection/sequence) has $x_2$ (number) members
$s_1$=$c_1$ is logged into system/application $s_2$=$c_2$.
$g_1$=$v_3$ registers $c_1$ as a member of $c_2$, registration preserved in medium $x_3$=$v_4$.
$x_1$ is an eligible/potential voter in issue (list of options) $x_2$, (with $x_1$) being a voting member of group $x_3$.
$z_1$=$c_1$ participates in employing means/taking action $z_2$ for purpose/goal $z_3$.
$x_1$ entertains axiomatic belief that $x_2$ is the case.
$x_1$=$z2$=$j_1$ is an infrastructure built by $x_2$=$z$=$1$ out of $x_3$=$z_3$ for $x_4$=$j_2$
$x_1$ is an element of kind $x_2$ with purity $x_3$.
$x_1$ (du'u) is an axiom/doctrine/creed/postulate about subject $x_2$, foundational to system $x_3$
column8: $x_1$=$krici_2$=$jicmu_1$, $x_2$=$krici_3$, $x_3$=$jicmu_2$. The system may be religious, philosophical, scientific, or mathematical. Refers to any proposition assumed as true without being proved within the system itself. See {sruma}

column2: $d_1$=$c_1$ is a chisel for carving $d_2$=$c_2$ with blade of material $d_3$.

$x_1$ (li) is the (signed) difference between the average of all elements/data of $x_2$ (completely specified ordered multiset/list) and single number $x_3$ (li; default: infimum of $x_2$ under ordering $x_6$ if such is finite), using averaging function $x_4$ (default: arithmetic average), weights $x_5$ (completely specified ordered multiset/list with the same cardinality/length as $x_2$; default: according to notes), and inherited ordering $x_6$ (default: standard ordering on the set of reals).
column8: Default for $x_5$ is the same as the default for the weights of the given averaging function $x_4$, which for the arithmetic mean of a finite set is the ordered set of $|x_2|$ terms with each term equal identically to $1/|x_2|$, where "| |" represents the cardinality of its input (circumfixed). $x_6$ is defined on a superset of $x_2$ united with the singleton of $x_3$. The default for $x_6$ is {mrenspoi}. For example: If $x_2 = (1, 7)$ and all of the defaults hold, then $x_1 = avg(1,7) - min(1,7) = 4 - 1 = 3$; when all defaults hold and $x_2$ is a bounded set, $x_1$ is the difference between the arithmetic average of (or average of the uniform distribution on) $x_2$ and the infimum of $x_2$. See also: "{sigma}".

column2: $x_1$ makes $x_2$ vary in property $x_3$ in amount $x_4$ under conditions $x_5$
$x_1$ is the derivative of $x_2$ with respect to $x_3$.
$x_1$ feels $x_2$ (ka) about $x_3$ feeling $x_4$ (ka) about $x_5$
$co_1$=$ci_1$ hurts emotionally due to $ci_3$.
$d_1$=$c_1$ is far/distant from $d_2$ in feeling $d_3$=$c_2$.
$j_1$=$c_1$ shows emotion $j_2$=$c_2$ (ka) about $c_3$ to audience $j_3$.
$x_1$ empathizes with $x_2$ in feeling $x_3$.
$x_1$ emotionally believes $x_2$ (du'u) about subject $x_3$
column8: May or may not contrast with one's more-conscious or rational beliefs; related to the concept of "alief" ({kricili}). See {cinmo}, {krici}, {cnisenpi}

column2: $x_1$ 'reacts' with emoji $x_2$ ({ci'e'u}) to message/post $x_3$
$x_1$ is an emoji representing $x_2$
$x_1$=$c_1$=$m_1$ feels flattered about $x_2$=$c_3$=$m_2$.
$v_1$ is an interjection/attitudinal meaning $v_2$=$c_1$ in language $v_3$.
$x_1$=$m_1$ is a therapist treating $x_2$=$m_2$=$c_1$ for $x_3$=$m_3$=$c_2$ with treatment $x_4$=$m_4$.
$x_1$=$m_1$=$c_3$ is romantic to $x_2$=$m_2$; $x_1$ is beautiful to $x_2$ because it follows or is based on some emotional ideal that may not actually reflect reality.
column8: Not "romantic" in the sense of "pertaining to intimate love" (={cinpamra'a}); rather, "romantic" in the sense of viewing emotions as a higher and more important quality with extraordinary properties. See also {cinmo}, {melbi}.

column2: $x_1$ (event/state) feels (emotionally) good / pleasant / nice to $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$
$r_1$ is the sense/feeling in $c_1$ of emotion $c_2$ about $c_3$.
$x_1$=$p_1$ is a question about $x_3$=$c_2$=$p_4$’s emotion, asked by $x_2$=$p_3$ to $x_3$=$c_3$=$p_4$.
$x_1$=$r_1$ (event) moves/touches $x_2$=$c_1$ (person), causing emotion $x_3$=$c_2$ about object of emotion $x_4$=$c_3$ with causation conditions $x_5$=$r_3$; $x_1$=$r_1$ (event) is moving/touching.
$s_1$ is the heart (emotional self) of $s_2$=$c_1$.
$x_1$ emotionally disbelieves $x_2$ (du'u) about subject $x_3$
column8: May or may not contrast with one's more-conscious or rational beliefs; related to the concept of "alief" ({kricili}). See {cinmo}, {senpi}, {cnikri}

column2: $x_1$=$ci_1$=$cu_1$ expresses emotion $x_2$=$ci_2$=$cu_2$/emotionally expresses $x_2$ for audience $x_3$=$cu_3$ via expressive medium $x_4$=$cu_4$.
$t_1$=$c_2$ is the mood experienced by $t_2$=$c_1$ about $c_3$.
$v_1$ sighs due to emotion $c_2$ (ka) about $c_3$ breathing/respiring $v_2$.
$x_1$ is therapy, given to patient $x_2$ for ailment $x_3$ by therapist $x_4$
$xr_1$ offends $xr_2$=$c_1$ affecting emotion $c_2$ (ka) about $c_3$ resulting in $xr_4$ (state).
$c_1$=$n_1$ is deep inside $n_2$ by standard $c_4$
column8: From la berenstein cribe 2020/11/17 See also {condi},{nenri}

column2: $x_1$=$p_1$ is the t(h)alweg (path following the deepest points along the course) in/of/belonging to geographical/hydrological/potential feature $x_2$=$c_1$=$t_1$ from $x_3$=$p_2$ to $x_4$=$p_3$
column8: Potential in the definition refers to the scalar field, a sense used in physics.

column2: $x_1$=$cf_1$ [state/event/process] commences/initiates/starts/begins to occur from its natural start; (intransitive verb).
column8: See {co'a} {cfari}. $x_1$ starts from the very beginning. Also in the sense of 'starting anew' or 'starting from scratch'.

column2: $b_1$ starts to become $b_2$ under conditions $b_3$.
$c_1$ (agent) starts to express/say $c_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $c_3$ via expressive medium $c_4$.
$x_1$ kneels/genuflects with meaning $x_2$ on surface $x_3$ on/with limb(s) $x_4$ of body $x_5$.
column8: Usually implies obeisance, homage, devotion, loyalty, obedience, subservience, vulnerability, or some other form of inferiority or trust. Specify the recipient of said inferiority or trust expression via/in $x_2$. Mere "{cidytse}" is an action which may not convey any semantic information. This word uses experimental rafsi "-coc-", which has been proposed to be assigned to experimental gismu "{corci}". This word is, for now, equivalent to "{cidytsecorci}", mostly because .krtisfranks. cannot semantically distinguish between "a kneeling-type-of semantic-gesture" and "a semantic-gesture-type-of kneeling".

column2: $k_1$ plays charades/gesture-game $ci_1$=$k_2$ governed by rules $ci_2$ interrelating game parts (physical or conceptual; includes gestures) $ci_3$
column8: From {corci} {ciste} {kelci}. corci1 is included in ciste3. See also {cockei}

column2: $s_1$=$c_1$ is a deep/rumbling sound produced by $s_2$=$c_2$ from point of reference $c_3$.
column8: $c_3$ could also be interpreted as a particular pitch/frequency. See also: {condi}, {sance}.

column2: $x_1$ is a thingamajig / thing which the speaker can't put a predicate upon
$x_1$ makes $x_2$ be in some unspecified relation with $x_3$; $x_1$ assigns / pairs up $x_2$ and $x_3$.
$c_1$=$b_1$ is a deep-sea submarine for carrying $b_2$, propelled by $b_3$
$g_1$ (agent) hurts/causes pain for $c_1$ at locus $c_2$.
$x_1$ quits/stops/aborts waiting/pausing for/until $x_2$ at state $x_3$ and starts/continues with $x_4$ (activity/process).
column8: The pause waiting is not completed. See {co'u}, {denpa}.

column2: $d_1$ is relieved from stress/discomfort $d_2$
$x_1$ (event) has ceased happening and is not expected to start again.
$j_1$ dies / ceases to live; alive according to standard $j_2$.
$g_1$ causes $c_1$ to [rest on]/[be on top of]/[lie on] $c_2$ in frame of reference $c_3$.
column5: cause to be on top;cause to lie on;cause to rest on

column2: $g_1$=$c_1$ rides/mounts/has sexual intercourse on top of $g_2$=$c_2$, in frame of reference/gravity $c_3$.
$f_1$=$c_1$ refuses $f_2$=$c_2$ from $c_3$.
$z_1$=$c_1$ approves the receipt of $c_2$ from $c_3$.
$x_1$ ask each other for/request from each other $x_2$ in manner/form $x_3$
$cu_1$=$cp_1$ pleas/[expresses request] $cu_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept)  to $cu_3$=$cp_3$ via expressive medium $cu_4$.
column5: ask for by saying;request by saying

column2: $x_1$ complies with/accedes to request $x_2$ made by $x_3$.
$x_1$ complies with request $x_2$ from $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a gryphon/griffin/griffon.
$s_1$ is a sense-irritating plant/thistle of species $x_2$.
$t_1$=$c_1$ is a hot/pungent spice causing flavor/effect $t_2$ (event/property).
$x_1$ is a scarecrow for scaring off birds $x_2$
$z_1$ is a nest of bird $z_2$=$c_1$ of genus/species/etc. $c_2$.
$b_1$=$l_1$ is/are (an) ox/oxen [cattle/beef-producer/bovine] for pulling/drafting $l_2$ by handle $l_3$ of species/breed $b_2$.
$c_1$ is a horse cab/carriage/equipage for carrying $c_2$, propelled by animal(s) $l_1$=$c_3$ by handle/at locus $l_3$.
$x_1$ is a rowing boat or sculler, carrying $x_2$, pulled by $x_3$.
$x_1$ rows or sculls on route $x_2$ with boat, rowing boat or scull $x_3$.
$l_1$=$m_1$ is a tractor pulling $l_2$.
$g_1$=$l_1$ pulls $m_1$=$l_2$ to destination $m_2$ from origin $m_3$ over path/route $m_4$ at handle/locus $l_3$.
$p_1$ is a harpsichord.
$c_1$ is a radio transceiver transmitting/receiving $c_2$ on frequency $c_3$ to/from transceiver $c_4$.
column8: The $x_3$ place may specify more than one frequency, for instance in cases where different frequencies are used for transmission and receipt. Cf. {veltivni}.

column2: $s_1$ is a front vowel sound.
$ci_1$=$cr_1$ is a heads-up display (HUD) for user $s_1$ of machine/system $s_2$ based on principle $ci_3$. It is shown/visible in front of $cr_2$, as seen from the user's viewpoint.
column8: A very general sense of “heads-up display” is used here; it is not limited to one single application. For example, it could be used to refer to both the heads-up display of modern aircraft as well as the heads-up display in computing and video games. Cf. {crane}, {sazycimde}.

column2: $k_1$=$c_1$ advances to $k_2$ from $k_3$=$c_2$ via $k_4$ using means/vehicle $k_5$.
$k_1$ is an anteroom of/in structure $k_2$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $k_3$ (mass/jo'u).
$l_1$ is an initial letter in alphabet/character-set $l_2$ representing $l_3$.
$t_1$=$c_1$ is/are the frontmost among set/range $t_4$ which faces/in-frame-of-reference $c_3$.
column8: Be careful not to use this when {li'enrai} is meant.  Their meanings may overlap somewhat.

column2: $x_1$ is a president; $x_1$ is president of $x_2$
column8: Wide sense; like {jatna}, plus the "president" title. See also {ianlaua}, {gugja'a}, {kagja'a}, {presidente}

column2: $v_1$=$c_1$ is a front door/gateway/access between $v_2$ and $v_3$ of structure $v_4$.
$p_1$ is the front-cover picture/image/illustration showing $p_2$ made by artist $p_3$.
column5: front cover illustration;front cover image;front cover picture

column2: $c_1$=$b_1$ becomes expert at $c_2$=$b_2$ under conditions $b_3$ by standard $c_3$.
column8: Coined because {cilre} makes it hard to talk about just learning about a subject. Cf. {ckule}, {saske}, {ctuca}.

column2: $x_1$ (event) is a test/examination of $x_2$'s skill/competence in subject $x_3$
$j_1$=$c_2$ is a profession (job) of person $j_2$=$c_1$.
column8: Especially a job requiring a high level of skill or training. Cf. {jibri}, {gunka}, {certu}.

column2: $cu_1$ is a barista/is skilled at making coffee drink/product $cu_2$=$ck_1$ by process $cu_3$.
column8: See also espresso (={kafrspreso}), coffeehouse/coffee bar (={kafybarja}), espresso machine (={cabrspreso}).

column2: $x_1$ does $x_2$ in a skilled manner
$x_1$ (person) has rank/skill level $x_2$ (li) in discipline/game/activity $x_3$
$x_1$=$ce_1$=$cu_1$ expertly produces artwork $x_2$=$cu_2$ of craft/skill $x_3$=$ce_2$=$l_2$ by process $x_4$=$cu_3$ expertly produced by standard $x_5$=$ce_3$.
$x_1$ suggests/offers expert advice/protip $x_2$ (ka) to $x_3$.
$j_1$=$c_1$ skillfully handles $j_2$=$c_2$ in event $j_3$.
$c_1$=$xa_1$ is a geek/nerd of field $c_2$=$xa_2$ (event/activity) by standard $c_3$.
$x_1$ practices/exercises/drills/trains in/for action/event/performance $x_2$.
$x_1$ is bearberry of species/variety $x_2$.
$s_1$ (mass of facts) is the science of fairies/elves/pixies [mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion $c_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
column5: science of elves;science of fairies;science of gnomes;science of goblins;science of mythical humanoids;science of pixies;science of sprites

column2: $x_1$=$g_1$ causes $x_2$=$c_1$ to lose property $x_3$=$c_2$
column8: The third place of cirko is the event itself. cf. {cirko} and {gasnu}

column2: $x_0$: No pain, no gain. You have to work for what you want. (nullary predicate)
$x_1$ is a painkiller for locus (body part) $x_2$
$g_1$ (agent) hurts/causes pain for $c_1$ at locus $c_2$.
$g_1$ practices sadomasochism with $g_2$=$c_1$ with pain at locus $c_2$.
$r_1$ (event/state) hurts/causes pain for $x_2$=$c_1$ at locus $x_3$=$c_2$.
$t_1$ is hot spice.
$v_1$ is a hot/spicy taste/flavor of/emitted by $v_2$.
$x_1$=$j_1$=$c_1$ is a rule permitting/allowing $x_2$=$j_2$=$c_2$ (event/state) within system/community $x_3$=$j_3$ under conditions $x_4$=$c_3$
column8: The use of $c_1$ there is perhaps a bit iffy; the point here is that it's non-agentive.

column2: $t_1$ is a situation / condition / state / position that allows / is sufficient for event $c_2$=$t_2$ under conditions $c_3$.
column8: As the whole point of this word is to ignore the agentive nature of c1, c1 has been dropped.  Cf. {curmi}, {tcini}, {rau}, {banzu}.

column2: $v_1$ is a permit allowing $c_2$ (event) under conditions $c_3$, preserved in medium $v_4$.
$x_1$ is a type theory.
$k_1$=$c_1$ is the audit committee of $k_3$.
$x_1$ is a nightjar/goatsucker/whippoorwill of genus/species $x_2$.
$c_1$ is an owl of species $c_2$.
$c_1$ is a slipper (shoe primarily for wearing at night) for wearing on [feet/hooves] $c_2$, made of material $c_3$.
$d_1$ is dew.
$m_1$ is dark of night of day $n_2$ at location $n_3$.
$m_1$ is the midnight of $n_2$ at location $n_3$.
$c_1$ is nocturnal/active during the nighttime $n_1$.
$f_1 = r_1 = x_1$ (event; perhaps: spacetime coordinates) is an equinox for season $x_2$ at location/of or for celestial body/object $d_3 = x_3$ with respect to orbit/sun $x_4$.
column8: This word is perfectly and exactly semantically equivalent to "{dornilteikeznulfau}", except at most in terms of emphasis and connotation and poetic value. Unlike the pair "{ctenilteikezraifau}" and "{dornilteikezraifau}", neither of the "equinox" words herein referenced thus far have a default or preference for any given season.

column2: $f_1 = r_1 = x_1$ (event; perhaps: spacetime coordinates) is a solstice of extreme $r_3 = x_2$ ("ka" construct or season; default: "ka zmadu", which means "Winter solstice", unless context makes this interpretation untenable) at location/of or for celestial body/object $d_3 = x_3$ with respect to orbit/sun $x_4$.
column8: This word is exactly analogous to "{dornilteikezraifau}" and (conceptually speaking) does nothing other than merely multiplying dornilteikezraifau$_2$ by $-1$. All of the notes and commentary for that word apply here. See also: "{ctenilteikeznulfau}".

column2: $x_1$ is a nightingale of species/variety $x_2$.
$s_1$ is a supper composed of dishes including $s_2$.
$cin_1$ is a/are chopstick(s) for eating $cit_2$.
$d_1$ is a table knife for cutting food $d_2$=$c_2$, with blade of material $d_3$.
$x_1$ has appetite for $x_2$
$x1$=$s1$=$c2$ is a caviar made of the roe of fish species $x2$=$s2$=$f2$
$f_1$ is a table fork for eating $c_2$, having tines/prongs $f_3$ on base/support $f_4$.
column8: cf. {ctidakfu}, {ctitci}. Note that {forca} is specific enough in most contexts, even more so than {dakfu}, due to not being confusable with t.ex. {tamcydakfu}.

column2: $g_1$ feeds $c_1$ with food $c_2$.
$x1$=$k1$ is a bowl for food $x2$=$c2$=$k2$ made from material $x3$=$k3$
$sm_1$=$b_1$ is/are tablespoon(s) [item of cutlery] suitable for eating $sm_2$=$c_2$ made of material $s_3$.

column8: In Lojban, cunrafsi are {rafsi} (bound combining forms) that derive unpredictably from {gismu} (root predicate-words). They are morphemes of the forms CCV, CVC, CVV, and CV'V (where C is a consonant, V is a vowel, and ' is the special sound /h/). Rafsi of these forms must be memorized alongside their source gismu, since they are assigned arbitrarily (within some constraints). By contrast, rafsi of the forms CCVC and CVCC are always predictable, and match up one-for-one with gismu; these may be called {jvarafsi} ('rule-rafsi'). Note also: cunrafsi are not 'irregular' in the sense of being assigned informally in a non-standard manner; they are a part of standard, official Lojban.

column2: $pr_1$ is (a) heterosexual.

column2: $x_1$ (currency) is change for $x_2$ (currency), with $x_1$ having units $x_3$ (collection of values of currency involved).
column8: Change is a collection of currency ($x_1$) which has the same monetary value as another collection of currency ($x_2$) such that some of the currency involved is different (usually the units of currency are each of lesser monetary value than those being exchanged from $x_2$). For example: a single bill worth 20.00$ can be exchanged for four bills each of which are worth 5.00$; the latter collection is change for the former (the single bill); both collections have the same total monetary value, but some of the currency (material item encoding or possessing monetary value) in the latter each has lesser monetary value than some of the currency in the former.

column2: $x_1$=$d_1$=$t_1$ occurs on year $x_2$ of month $x_3$ of day $x_4$ of hour $x_5$ of minute $x_6$ of second $x_7$ of date/time system $x_8$
column8: Created to give date and time simultaneously and to be in line with ISO standard from most general to most specific. Milliseconds can be added after "{pi}" in the seconds place. See: {detytcika} {dei'i'u}

column2: $x1$ (event) is an experience of harm found pleasurable by $x2$ under conditions $x3$.  $x2$ feels Schadenfreude about event $x1$.

column8: x1 and x2 are the same as for "togyku'e", while x5 corresponds to the x3 of "togyku'e". The x3 and x4 of this word correspond to different constructions that "should" result in the same pitch, but don't (e.g. four 3/2 fifths vs. one 5/4 major third, for the syntonic comma of 81/80). This word is not to be used for a "microtone" in general - that is "cmato'aku'e". See also: {togyku'e}, {cmato'aku'e}.

column5: define x such that;existential instantiation;let x be such that
column8: This is not a standard assertion/claim proposition, instead being an assignment statement/directive (has an implicit "{ko}"); as such, it does not really have a truth value (or its truth value is TRUE because of itself). A thing such as $x_1$ need not exist, although non-existence is also not implied; this bridi abstains from resolving the question of $x_1$'s existence. "{ca'e}", "{ckaji}", "{da}", "{poi}", "{zo'u}".

See also {stela}.

column2: $co_1$ is a/the anterior (zootomy)/cranial/cephalic end (anatomy)/superior end (human anatomy) of body/object $cl_1$; $co_1$ (subevent) is at the starting point of long event/time-intervall $cl_1$.
column8: Metaphor: A tree grows in its long direction, with the roots as its starting point ({co'a}) and the crown as its ending point ({co'u}). Standard anatomical term to avoid ambiguity. In vertebrate usually the head, in invertebrate the end with a mouth (or equivalent structure), or the end that usually points in the direction of the organism's locomotion. See also anterior/superior absolute position ({claco'uklo}), anterior/superior relative position ({claco'umau}), posterior/inferior end ({claco'u}), anteroposterior (A-P) axis ({selcla}), ventral/anterior end ({befco'u}), dorsal/posterior end ({tolbefco'u}).

column2: $co_1$ is a/the anterior (zootomy)/cranial/cephalic end (anatomy)/superior end (human anatomy)/fore/bow (nautical)/nose (skateboard etc), of body/object $cl_1$; $co_1$ (subevent) is at the ending point of long event/time-intervall $cl_1$.
column8: Metaphor: A tree grows in its long direction, with the roots as its starting point ({co'a}) and the crown as its ending point ({co'u}). Standard anatomical term to avoid ambiguity, but not restricted to anatomical objects. In vertebrate usually the head, in invertebrate the end with a mouth (or equivalent structure), or the end that usually points in the direction of the organism's locomotion. In most animals the same as the front (={craraipau}), but in humans the same as the top (={gapraipau}). See also anterior/superior absolute position ({claco'uklo}), anterior/superior relative position ({claco'umau}), posterior/inferior end ({claco'a}), anteroposterior (A-P) axis ({selcla}), ventral/anterior end ({befco'u}), dorsal/posterior end ({tolbefco'u}/{bekpyco'u}).

column2: $co_1$=$d_1$ is/are anterior (zootomy)/cranial/cephalic (anatomy)/superior  (human anatomy) with frame-of-reference body/object $cl_1$=$d_3$.
column8: Standard anatomical term to avoid ambiguity, but not restricted to anatomical objects. In most animals the same as the front (={craraipau}), but in humans the same as the top (={gapraipau}). See also anterior/superior end ({claco'u}), anterior/superior relative position ({claco'umau}), posterior/inferior end ({claco'a}), anteroposterior (A-P) axis ({selcla}), ventral/anterior end ({befco'u}), dorsal/posterior end ({tolbefco'u}/{bekpyco'u}).

column2: $co_1$=$z_1$ is/are anterior (zootomy)/cranial/cephalic (anatomy)/superior (human anatomy) to $z_2$ by margin $z_4$, in body/object $cl_1$=$d_3$.
column8: Standard anatomical term to avoid ambiguity, but not restricted to anatomical objects. In most animals the same as 'in front of' (={crane}), but in humans the same as 'above' (={gapru}). See also anterior/superior absolute position ({claco'uklo}), anterior/superior relative position ({claco'umau}), posterior/inferior end ({claco'a}), anteroposterior (A-P) axis ({selcla}), ventral/anterior end ({befco'u}), dorsal/posterior end ({tolbefco'u}/{bekpyco'u}).

column2: $x_1$ is a long knife
column8: This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL

column2: $xa_1$=$d_1$=$c_1$ is a sword / long knife weapon for use against $xa_2$=$d_2$ by $xa_3$ with blade of material $d_3$ long by standard $c_3$.

$t_1$ is a grape tomato of variety/strain $t_2$.

$x_1$ (object/dimension) is shortest among set $x_2$ (set) in respective dimensions $x_3$ (default: the longest for each).
column8: Equivalent to "{toryrai}". Partially an .{u'ivla}, but with a little bit of philosophical underpinning: We should measure things by how much they have rather than how much they lack (good: how bright, how strong, how rich; bad: how dark, how weak, how poor) because 0 is the natural starting point and the quantity usually can be increased without upper bound. So, longness is a thing and shortness is a figment of our collective imagination, so to speak. So, "shortest" should really be "least long". Meanwhile, "{traji}" can accept either valence for extremeness, but defaults to the positive (id est: "most"), so we need to cajole it into the opposite ("least"). Thus, we get this long, gross word.

column2: $cr_1$=$k_2$ is an elf [long-eared mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion $cr_2$
$x_1$=$r_1$=$k_2$ is a hare of species $x_2$=$r_2$
