column8: $x_2$ may be a subject, but not all journals have a single subject; all have some sort of principle defining what is included, so this need not be a list.  See also {papri}, {pelji}, {tcidu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (tool/blade/force) cuts [through]/splits/divides $x_{2}$ (object) into pieces $x_{3}$.
column8: For $x_1$ force, it is a force acting as a blade, not acting upon a blade; agentive cutting (= {ka'argau}, {ka'arzu'e}).  (cf. {kakpa}, {sraku} for cutting into without division; {plixa}, {dakfu}, {jinci}, {porpi}, {spofu}, {tunta}, {xrani}, {fatri}, {fendi}, {balre}, {dilcu})

column2: $x_{1}$ captures/catches/apprehends/seizes/nabs $x_{2}$ with trap/restraint $x_{3}$.
column8: Catch something thrown (= {rerkavbu}).  See also {jersi}, {kalte}, {pinfu}, {sisku}, se {rinju}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (person) pities/feels sorry for $x_{2}$ (person) about $x_{3}$ (abstraction).
$x_{1}$ [agent] plays with plaything/toy $x_{2}$.
column8: Play game (= {ci'erkei}), play competitively (= {jvikei}).  See also {jivna}, {jinga}, {zdile}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ degree(s) Kelvin [metric unit] in temperature (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cancer [malignant disease] in $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is outer space near/associated with celestial body/region $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the hair/fur [body-part] of $x_{2}$ at body location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the ear [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus, information gathering].
$x_{1}$ reflects South American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cavity/hole/hollow/cavern in $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is concave within $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ is hollow at locus $x_{1}$.
column8: Also pit, depression, concavity; hollow (= {selke'a}).  See also {fenra}, {kunti}, {canlu}, {canko}, {galxe}, {tubnu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ cushions $x_{2}$ with material $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a cushion/pillow/pad [for $x_{2}$] of padding material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of oxygen (O); [metaphor: supporting life/combustion].
$x_{1}$ is a thousand [1000; $10^3$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is sharp/keen at locus $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Pakistani/Pashto culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ weeps/cries tears $x_{2}$ about/for reason $x_{3}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ comes/goes to destination $x_{2}$ from origin $x_{3}$ via route $x_{4}$ using means/vehicle $x_{5}$.
column8: Also travels, journeys, moves, leaves to ... from ...; $x_1$ is a traveller; ($x_4$ as a set includes points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly).  See also {cadzu}, {bajra}, {marce}, {vofli}, {litru}, {muvdu}, {cpare}, cmavo list {ka'a}, {pluta}, {bevri}, {farlu}, {limna}, {vitke}.

column2: $x_1$ is measured by $x_2$ (number) on scale $x_3$ (si'o, property of $x_1$ with kau).
column8: Also count. To specify the number of objects, {loi} is usually used in x1 of klani. To specify size, fill x3 of klani. See also cmavo list {la'u}, {namcu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (mass/si'o) is a class/category/subgroup/subset within $x_{2}$ with defining property $x_{3}$ (ka).
column8: Also taxon, type, kind, classification, species, genus, family, order, phylum.  See also cmavo list {le'a}, {cmima}, {jutsi}, {ciste}, {girzu}, {lanzu}, {vrici}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (object/medium) is clear/transparent/without obstacle to in-the-clear $x_{2}$ [transmission].
column8: Also lucid; $x_2$ remains apparent/lucid/clear (figurative use for 'understandable' is discouraged, better expressed as = {filseljmi} or {filsmu}).  (cf. {kandi}, {zunti} - {nalzu'i} is better for 'unhindered')

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of halogen of type $x_{2}$ [chlorine, fluorine, iodine, etc.].
column8: Also bromine; default chlorine. See also {xukmi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of clay [moist, clammy dirt] of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a screw [fastener] for purpose $x_{2}$, threads [pitch, material] $x_{3}$, frame [size, material] $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (obj.) is loose/bloused/not tight on $x_{2}$ (obj.) at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of cabbage/lettuce/leafy vegetable of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a corner/point/at-least-3-dimensional [solid] angle [shape/form] in/on $x_{2}$, of material $x_{3}$.
column8: Also apex; a corner exists on three dimensions but need not be limited to points; it suggests a discontinuity in slope in some direction; i.e. in some planar cross-section.  See also {jipno}, {konju}, {bliku}, {fanmo}, {jganu}, {krasi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of coal/peat/anthracite/bitumen from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a comb [many-needled shape] of material $x_{2}$ with tines/needles $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cone [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$ with vertex $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an edge/margin/border/curb/boundary of $x_{2}$ next-to/bordering-on $x_{3}$.
(adjective:) $x_{1}$ is bent/crooked/not straight or direct/[twisted]/folded.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cork/bark from tree/species $x_{2}$; [material].
$x_{1}$ is a coat/jacket/sweater/cloak/[cape/shawl/pullover] [extra outer garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ local area unit(s) [non-metric] (default 1) by standard $x_{3}$, $x_{4}$ subunits.
column8: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (site/event) is a source/start/beginning/origin of $x_{2}$ (object/event/process).
column8: Also root (figurative sense); (adjective:) $x_1$ is initial.  See also {fanmo}, cmavo list {ra'i}, {sabji}, {cfari}, {jipno}, {traji}, {kojna}, {genja}, {jicmu}, {sitna}, {jinto}.

column2: $x_{1}$ represents/is an agent/proxy/stands-in for [absent] $x_{2}$ in matter(s)/function(s) $x_{3}$.
column8: Also: on behalf of.  See also cmavo list {ka'i}, {jansu}, {catni}, {vipsi}, {pulji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event) is the $x_{3}$'rd recurrence/repetition of $x_{2}$ (abstract); $x_{2}$ happens again in [form] $x_{1}$.
column8: Also case, another, instance, different, other, time, occasion.  See also {fukpi}, {rapli}, {cafne}, {fasnu}, {xruti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ believes [regardless of evidence/proof] belief/creed $x_{2}$ (du'u) is true/assumed about subject $x_{3}$.
column8: without evidence refers to objective external evidence; also gives credence, has conviction.  See also {jinvi}, {djuno}, {censa}, {cevni}, {lijda}, {makfa}, {malsi}, {senpi}, {birti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of crystal of composition $x_{2}$ in form/arrangement $x_{3}$.
column8: $x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification.  See also {jemna}, {bisli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (event/state) is a reason/justification/explanation for/causing/permitting $x_{2}$ (event/state).
column8: See also {ciksi}, {rinka}, {nibli}, {mukti}, se {jalge}, te {zukte}, cmavo list {ki'u}, {bapli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ cries out/yells/howls sound $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a crier.
$x_{1}$ intersects/crosses/traverses $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of cream/emulsion/puree [consistency] of composition $x_{2}$.
column8: [$x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification]]; See also {ladru}, {matne}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a curve/turn/bend in $x_{2}$, at locus $x_{3}$, and defined by set of points/properties $x_{4}$.
column8: (adjective:) $x_1$ is curved; ($x_4$ as a set of points is sufficiently specified to identify the relevant properties of the bend).  See also {korcu}, {bargu}, {genxu}, {linji}, {sirji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a lake/lagoon/pool at site/within land mass $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is adjacent/beside/next to/in contact with $x_{2}$ in property/sequence $x_{3}$ in direction $x_{4}$.
column8: Also touching, contiguous, against.  See also {zvati}, {cpana}, {jibni}, {diklo}, {stuzi}, {bartu}, {jbini}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of protein/albumin of type $x_{2}$ composed of amino acids (sequence/jo'u) $x_{3}$ .
$x_{1}$ is a flag/banner/standard of/symbolizing $x_{2}$ with pattern(s) $x_{3}$ on material $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a basket with contents $x_{2}$, woven from material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ analyzes/examines-in-detail $x_{2}$ by method/technique/system $x_{3}$ [process/activity].
$x_{1}$ is a sheep/[lamb/ewe/ram] of species/breed $x_{2}$ of flock $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a can/tightly sealed/pre-sealed container for perishable contents $x_{2}$, made of $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is in balance/equilibrium under forces $x_{2}$ (mass).
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a family with members including $x_{2}$ bonded/tied/joined according to standard $x_{3}$.
column8: Also clan, tribe; $x_2$ is in $x_1$, a member of $x_1$ ({selylanzu} for reordered places); relative (= {lazmi'u} - xy mintu y'y leka cmima da poi lanzu).  See also {natmi}, {cmima}, {girzu}, {jutsi}, {klesi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (process) is an art [creative application] of craft/skill $x_{2}$ (idea/activity).
$x_{1}$ (agent) fastens/connects/attaches/binds/lashes $x_{2}$ to $x_{3}$ with fastener $x_{4}$.
column8: No implication that result is considered a single object; although $x_2$ and $x_3$ may be reversible, $x_3$ may be used for the substrate, the fixed/larger object to which $x_2$ becomes attached. See also {jorne}, {fenso}, {jgena}, {batke}, {dinko}, {kansa}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of brass [copper/zinc alloy] of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is mature/ripe/fully-grown/adult in development-quality $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is magic/supernatural/sorcery/witchcraft/wizardry to $x_{2}$, performed by person/force/deity $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is magnetic [adjective] producing magnetic field $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a temple/church/sanctuary/synagogue/shrine of religion $x_{2}$ at location/serving area $x_{3}$.
column8: $x_2$ may be event of form (... worships/pays/respect to ...), hence (metaphorically extending to) monument (= {mojmalsi}, {si'armalsi}).  See also {cevni}, {krici}, {lijda}, {ritli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a mother of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ bears/mothers/acts maternally toward $x_{2}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ feels wonder/awe/marvels about $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/event) is uniform/homogeneous in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is dark/lacking in illumination.
$x_{1}$ is a frame of reference/standard for observing/measuring/determining $x_{2}$, with/by rules $x_{3}$.
column8: ($x_1$ may be object or si'o idea); See also cmavo list {ma'i}, {ckilu}, {merli}, {pajni}, {cimde}, {jdice}, {marde}.

column2: $x_{1}$ satisfies evaluator $x_{2}$ in property (ka)/state $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an ant of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cap/hat/crown/helmet/piece of headgear [head-top garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cotton [type of fabric/material].
$x_{1}$ fits/matches/suits/is compatible/appropriate/corresponds to/with $x_{2}$ in property/aspect $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shelter/haven/refuge/retreat/harbor for/protecting $x_{2}$ from danger/threat $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a vehicle/mode of transport carrying $x_{2}$ in/on surface/medium $x_{3}$, propelled by $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ are the ethics/morals/moral standards/ethical standards of $x_{2}$ (ind./mass) about situation $x_{3}$.
column8: $x_1$ will (typically) be an abstract, a rule or rules of behavior; also principles; also conscience (= {sezmarde}).  See also {palci}, {vrude}, {lijda}, {manri}, {javni}, {tarti}, {zekri}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/made of mercury/quicksilver; [metaphor: fluid metal; temperature].
$x_{1}$ is material/stuff/matter of type/composition including $x_{2}$ in shape/form $x_{3}$.
column8: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is physical (one sense)/material.  See also {morna}, {mucti}, {nejni}, {tarmi}, {dacti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of hemp/marijuana/jute of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [force] mashes/crushes/squashes/smashes $x_{2}$ into pulp/mash/crumbs/deformed mass $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is slow/sluggish at doing/being/bringing about $x_{2}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ months in duration (default is 1 month) by month standard $x_{3}$.
column8: This month (= {cabma'i}); next month (= {bavla'ima'i}); last month (= {prula'ima'i}).  See also {detri}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {nanca}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a mat/pad/mattress/pallet [flat, soft, dense form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a million [$10^6$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ [quantifier/expression] is a mathematical expression interpreted under rules/convention $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is beautiful/pleasant to $x_{2}$ in aspect $x_{3}$ (ka) by aesthetic standard $x_{4}$.
column8: Also handsome, pretty, gorgeous, cute, comely, graceful.  See also {pluka}, {xamgu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ reflects Malaysian/Malay culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a mind/intellect/psyche/mentality/[consciousness] of body $x_{2}$.
column8: (adjective:) $x_1$ is mental/psychological/a mental phenomenon; multiple personalities (= so'i {menli}).  See also {besna}, {morji}, {mucti}, {pensi}, {sanji}, {xanri}, {sevzi}, {xadni}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a sister of/sororal to $x_{2}$ by bond/tie/standard/parent(s) $x_{3}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ minutes in duration (default is 1 minute) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to USA/American culture/nationality/dialect in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) measures/evaluates $x_{2}$ [quantity] as $x_{3}$ units on scale $x_{4}$ (si'o), with accuracy $x_{5}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Mexican culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is in/at the middle/center/midpoint/[is a focus] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is central.
$x_{1}$ is encoded/cipher text of plain-text $x_{2}$ by code/coding system $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is in code; $x_{3}$ is a code.
$x_{1}$ doctors/treats/nurses/[cures]/is physician/midwife to $x_{2}$ for ailment $x_{3}$ by treatment/cure $x_{4}$.
column8: Also medic; (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_4$ is medical; $x_2$ is a patient of $x_1$ (= selmikce for reordered places) ; $x_2$ is treated by $x_1$ person/$x_4$ treatment/method; successfully cure transitive (= {sadmikce}, {sadvelmikce}), intransitive (= sadyselmikce, ka'orbi'o to not imply an external agent/process, though the $x_1$ and $x_4$ of mikce may be self/internal); treatment (= {velmikce}).  See also {bilma}, {kanro}, {spita}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a millionth [$10^{-6}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a thousandth [1/1000; $10^{-3}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is mild/non-extreme/gentle/middling/somewhat in property $x_{2}$ (ka); $x_{1}$ is not very $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ issues commands/orders to $x_{2}$ for result $x_{3}$ (event/state) to happen; $x_{3}$ is commanded to occur.
column8: [also: $x_1$ orders/sets/Triggers. $x_2$ to do/bring about $x_3$; $x_1$ is a commander; commanded (= {termi'e})]; See also {lacri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {ralju}, {jitro}, {turni}, {tinbe}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a machine for use/function $x_{2}$; [automated apparatus, without direct function control].
column8: Also machinery/mechanism; a machine is initiated/triggered by an agent/force, but thereafter performs its function automatically; if self-directed, (a minji is an) entity (= {zukte}).  See also {cabra}, {matra}, {tutci}, {zukte}, {pilno}, {skami}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (default 1) long local distance unit(s) [non-metric], $x_{3}$ subunits, standard $x_{4}$.
column8: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {mitre}, {kilto}, {clani}, {ganra}, {condi}, {rotsu}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ reflects/mirrors/echoes $x_{2}$ [object/radiation] to observer/point $x_{3}$ as $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ bounces on $x_{1}$.
column8: Also: $x_1$ is a mirror/reflector.  $x_2$ may be light, lu'e of an imaged object; $x_4$ may be image or echo or the same as $x_2$ if physical object; $x_3$ may be a path for a bounced object; ka is reflection.  See also {catlu}, {viska}, {lenjo}, {pensi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is the same/identical thing as $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; ($x_{1}$ and $x_{2}$ interchangeable).
column8: (cf. {panra}, {satci}, {mapti}, {simsa}, {drata}, {dunli}, cmavo list {du} - which has no standard place, {simxu})

column2: $x_{1}$ keeps $x_{2}$ secret/hidden from $x_{3}$ by method $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ is a secret; $x_{1}$ hides/conceals $x_{2}$.
column8: Intransitive hidden/secret, without an agent (= {selcri} or {nalterju'o}); secret (= {selmipri}).  See also {stace}, {mifra}, {sivni}, {djuno}, {cirko}, {jarco}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a deer/elk/moose/[hart/stag/doe] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person/object/event) is famous/renowned/is a celebrity among community of persons $x_{2}$ (mass).
column8: Also celebrated/well-known; (derogative meanings:) notorious/infamous (= {malmi'o}; these could also be expressed using the referenced words).  See also se {sinma}, {banli}.

column2: $x_{1}$ reflects Egyptian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
convert selbri to nonce modal/sumti tag.
digit/number: fraction slash; default "/n" => 1/n, "n/" => n/1, or "/" alone => golden ratio.
{krati} modal, 1st place                            represented by ...
{ckaji} modal, 1st place                            characterizing ...
digit/number: imaginary i; square root of -1.
column8: Acts as a number punctuation mark (separating the real and the imaginary parts of a complex number); for example "ci ka'o re" means 3 + 2i. See also: {kau'o}, {ka'o'ai}, {ka'o'ei}.

column2: evidential: I know by cultural means (myth or custom).
discursive: marks word serving as focus of indirect question: "I know WHO went to the store".
start grouping of tanru, etc; ... type of ... ; overrides normal tanru left grouping.
pro-sumti: relativized sumti (object of relative clause).
elidable terminator: end of tanru left grouping override (usually elidable).
open interval bracket marker; modifies intervals in non-logical connectives; exclude boundaries.
elidable terminator: end abstraction bridi (often elidable).
vocative: please repeat.
discursive: \n{ke'u} - repeating\n{ke'unai} - continuing.
tense/modal: set/use tense default; establishes new open scope space/time/modal reference base.
attitudinal question: confusion about something said.
vocative: \n{ki'e} - thanks\n{ki'enai} - no thanks to you.
{ckini} modal, 1st place (related to)               relatively; as a relation of ...
digit/number: number comma; thousands.
{krinu} modal, 1st place (justified by)             justifiably; because of reason ...
pro-sumti: you (imperative); make it true for you, the listener.
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #1 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #2 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #3 (specified by goi).
{korbi} modal, 1st place (bordered by)              bounded by ...
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #4 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #5 (specified by goi).
elidable terminator: end description, modal, or negator sumti; often elidable.
non-logical connective: intersection of sets.
delimited non-Lojban name; the resulting quote sumti is treated as a name.
convert letteral string or other mathematical expression (mex) operand to mex operator.
{cmene} modal, 1st place (requires quote)           with name ...; so-called ...
digit/number: less than.
convert number to cardinality selbri; $x_{1}$ is a mass formed from a set $x_{2}$ of n members, one or more of which is/are $x_{3}$, measured relative to the set $x_{4}$.
column8: [$x_1$ is a mass with N components $x_3$ composing set $x_2$; $x_2$ is an n-tuple ($x_2$ is completely specified) (= {selmei} for reordered places); $x_1$ forms an n-some; $x_3$ (not necessarily a complete enumeration) are among the members of $x_2$); See also {cmima}, {gunma}, cmavo list {moi}.

column2: the mathematical expression (unevaluated); convert unevaluated mathematical expression to sumti.
elidable terminator: end sumti that was converted to selbri; usually elidable.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s); identified by self-vocative.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & others unspecified, but not you, the listener.
{mi'e} - self vocative: self-introduction; identifies speaker.\n{mi'enai} - denial of identity
non-logical interval connective: ordered components: ... center, ... range surrounding center.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & you the listener(s).
$x_1$ flirts with $x_2$ by doing $x_3$
$x_1$ is excited/feels excitement about $x_2$ (event/property); $x_2$ excites $x_1$

$x_1$ awaits for $x_2$ (event) with bated breath; $x_1$ waits for the occurrence of $x_2$ excitedly/restlessly; colloquially: $x_1$ just cannot wait for $x_2$ to happen; $x_1$ is eager for event $x_2$.
column8: The colloquial definition is figurative: the waiting must and will be performed, but $x_1$ wants $x_2$ to happen as soon as possible/to just come already- for time to flow faster. This is how a child feels on Christmas Eve night for Christmas Day. Usually positive; the negative version is essentially "dread". There should be a sense of longing (but future-oriented), intensity, and/or aching for what $x_1$ vaguely expects to happen (independent of what actually does end up happening). See also: {fizbu} (which lacks the sense of waiting), {denpa} (which lacks the sense of excitement and which has too many terbri). Proposed rafsi: "-fiz-".

column2: *$moved to {karmo}$*
$x_1$ expects/looks for the occurence of $x_2$ (event), expected likelihood $x_3$ (0-1, default {li} {so'a} i.e. near 1); $x_1$ subjectively evaluates the likelihood of $x_2$ (event) to be $x_3$.
column8: The value of $x_3$ is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to $x_1$, and is the basic determinant of whether kanpe means something like "hope" or "wish" or "expect", although kanpe never carries the connotation of desire; for that connotation see {pacna}. kanpe with $x_3$ not very close to 1 has no simple equivalent in English, but for objects/states with negligible expectation it is something like "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is something like "hoping". In both cases, though, the English implication of emotional desire is not present. The value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("{li} {piso'u}" to "{li} {piro}"); not-necessarily desirous wish, not necessarily desirous hope. See also {ba'a}, {djica}, {pacna}, {lakne}, {cunso}.

column2: $x_1$ is a chili/bell pepper (Capsicum) of species/variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is turned on / activated / operational for function $x_2$
column8: Syn. {akti}. Turned off = {ganda}, to turn on (agentive) = {katcygau}, to turn off (agentive) = {gandygau}. Also see {tolpo'u}.

column2: $x_1$ is a/the penis [body-part] of $x_2$
$x_1$ is "quasi" in property (ka) $x_2$; $x_1$ is "similar but not quite"/analogical to/comparable to having property $x_2$; $x_1$ is a quasi-$x_2$.
column8: Different from {simlu} in that {simlu} assumes that the seemingly present property is actually absent, and different from {simsa} in that {simsa} focuses on the similarity, whereas this word focuses on the difference.

column2: $x_1$ (li) is the cardinality of set $x_2$ (set)
column8: Exactly equivalent to {nilzilcmi} except in morphology. But cardinality is a pretty fundamental thing in mathematics (in some sense, even more fundamental than natural numbers), so it arguably deserves a gismu; this will also shorten many lujvo which should use a word for cardinality. The second terbri should technically be filled by a set, but other structures could probably be acceptable; these might include groups and other algebraic structures, multisets, lists, classes, vel sim. {ci'i} alone (without being followed by another (integer-representing) digit) indicates an infinite cardinality but not which one; beware the assumption of the Axiom of Choice or Generalized Continuum Hypothesis.

column2: $x_1$ reflects Quebec nationality/culture/geography in aspect $x_2$ (ka)
$x_{1}$ is $10^{(-30)}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_1$ is represents Celtic culture in aspect $x_2$
column8: Not necessarily confined to the British Isles. See also: {skoto}.

column2: $k_1$ is a quantity of cake/torte/tart/pie/flan made of/containing ingredients $k_2$, prepared according to method $k_3$.
$x_1$ (state/event/fact) is fair/just/righteous to $x_2$ according to $x_3$
column8: According to $x_3$, the way $x_2$ is treated in $x_1$ is just (it is "as things should be"). See also {pajni}, {sarxe}, {vrude}, {vudypai}, {nutli}, {pairnu'i}. (Many of those words deal with some judge acting "fairly" or "justly" in some matter, which kerni does not. In fact, a "to'e kerni" (unfair) situation is not necessarily the result of evil, may be considered unfair to all parties, and may be nobody's fault.)

column2: $x_1$ (property of $x_2$) is a stereotype of $x_2$ (object/set), held by $x_3$
column8: Does not necessarily carry a negative connotation. Stereotypes are, basically, the characteristics that come to one's mind when they imagine a particular object, regardless of actual commonality. e.g. Many people stereotypically think of roses as red, even though there are plenty of roses that aren't red. See {sei'i}, {lemkai}, {le'e}

column2: $x_{1}$ is $10^{30}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_1$ pertains to the internet/cyberspace in aspect $x_2$.
column8: Proposed by xorxes. Short rafsi -kib-. Cf. {mujysamseltcana}.

column2: $x_1$ is $x_2$ (default 1) kilograms [SI base unit] in mass by standard $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a binary relationship which is symmetric (under exchange of arguments/terms) in space/under conditions/on set $x_2$.
column8: Denote this binary relation $x_1$ between elements y, z (in that order) by "y R z" (in that order); then, for any elements a, b in the set of consideration (possibly $x_2$), if a R b, then b R a. See also: {kinra}, {takni}.

column2: $x_1$ is a binary relationship which is reflexive in space/under conditions/on set $x_2$.
column8: Denote this binary relation $x_1$ between elements y, z (in that order) by "y R z" (in that order); then, for any element 'a' in the set of consideration (possibly $x_2$), a R a. "Reflexive property" = "ka(m)( )kinra". See also: {takni}, {kinfi}.

column2: $x1$ keeps/raises $x2$ [animals] in sty/stall/stale/pen $x3$ for purpose $x4$
$x_1$ (set/space) is closed under(/wrt) operator/relation $x_2$; $x_2$ has closure in $x_1$.
column8: Identical to {klojere} but is a gismu (as it might be considered to be a fairly fundamental concept which is productive).

column2: $x_1$ is a coconut of variety/cultivar $x_2$
$x_1$ (set/shape) is convex in sense $x_2$.
column8: A function cannot really be convex (its epigraph can be though). This word is the gismu form of "{konvexi}".

column2: $s_1$ is a crow/raven of species $s_2$.
column8: See {cipnrkorvo} for a non-experimental version of this word.

column2: $x_1$ (abstraction) is a purpose/use of $x_2$ (object or event), attributed by $x_3$
column8: Place structure has been inverted from the original version to match {krinu}. Syn. {erpi}. See {ko'au}, {terpli}, {terzu'e}, {terfi'i}

column2: $x_1$ (NU) is a legal/moral entitlement of $x_2$ (individual/mass) by standard $x_3$. $x_2$ is a legal person.
column8: Normative principles, variously construed as legal, social, or moral freedoms or entitlements. {rarkrali} for "natural rights and {flakrali} for "legal rights"; {xuskrali} for "claim rights" and {zifkrali} for "liberty rights"; {srakrali} for "positive rights" and {ri'urkrali}/{badykrali} for "negative rights"; {sepkrali} for "individual rights" and {gumkrali} for "group rights"; {selcemkrali} for "civil rights" and {seljeckrali} for "political rights"; {jiknykrali} for "economic rights", {jikykrali} for "social rights", and {klukrali} for "cultural rights"; {remkrali} for "human rights" and {dalkrali} for "animal rights"; perhaps {kralyxai} for "violate". Cf. {selfla}, {selzi'e}, {terzi'e}, {selzau}, {selpikta}.

column2: $x_1$ is the core/nub/essence/heart/true part of entity/body/building/thing $x_2$
column8: Phonologically inspired from 'core', 'heart', and 心 (romaji: kokoro).

column2: $x_1$ is a lamp/candle/torch with fuel/power source $x_2$
column8: Refers to any artificial light source, whether flammable or electric. For "electric lamp," see {diclamdu}. See also {lanru}, {gusni}, {livla}.

column2: $x_1$ is the ISO-named country (or subdivision thereof) of people $x_2$ with ISO-name $x_3$, according to rule/specification $x_4$
$x_1$ is a lantern/flashlight/portable light source illuminating $x_2$, in style/with properties $x_3$
column8: Any small, portable light source designed to be carried; see {lamdu}, {fagri}, {gusni}.  It may be a garden decoration, so it may not even emit light, or light is metaphoric; see {jadni}.

column2: $x_1$ is an organism $x_2$ at its larva stage of development
$x_1$ is a microörganism, virus, protein, spore, pathogen, or other such substance which causes or is intimately associated with disease(s)/symptoms $x_2$.
$x_1$ is mauve [color]
$x_1$ is a mango [fruit] of species/variety $x_2$.
column8: {rutrmango} is the non-experimental synonym of “mango”. {ricrmango} for “mango tree”.

column2: x1 is ten thousand [10000; $10^4$] of x2 in dimension/aspect x3
$x_1$ is a quantity of fluff of composition/structure/characterization/substance $x_2$; $x_1$ is fluffy/airy/soft/fuzzy in texture
column8: Visual and tactile. Most likely is malleable, but this word has no such implications inherently; porousness or foaminess is likewise not implied. Might also include "cushiony", "cotton-like", "wool-like"; a fractal nature might be present.  For fuzziness: not necessarily hairy or furry, but must be soft; not bristly (which implies stiffness and hardness).  See also: {ranti}, {rufsu}, {xutla}, {panje}, {dilnu}, {mapni}, {sunla}, {fonmo}, {jduli}, {pesxu}, {marji}.

column2: (moved to "{matxe}") $x_1$
$x_1$ is a honey produced by $x_2$
$x_1$ is/are among the referent(s) of $x_2$
$x_1$ reflects Mesopotamian geography/chronology/culture/language/identity in aspect $x_2$
column8: This word could be applied to post-Islamic time periods, but it probably strongly connotes cultures and/or time periods of antiquity. See also: .{alcamacrike}, {lusto}, {bablo}, {sumro}, {xakto}, {semto}, {xrabo}.

column2: $x_1$ (bridi) is a metaphor/figurative expression having literal meaning $x_2$ to observer $x_3$
$x_1$ is localized public transport system for city/metropolitan region/locale/region $x_2$ using infrastructure/facilities/means of transportation $x_3$.
column8: This is mostly just to reserve the gismu space for "metro", which is begging to be made into a gismu; this may not be the best definition for the word space. Need not be a subway/underground train system.

column2: $g_2$=$f_1$ is apparent to $g_1$ via perceptual/cognitive faculty $g_3$.
column8: x3 includes reason or critical thinking skills as well as discrete biological organs such as eyes or ears. Cf. {frili}, {sapselga'e}, {sampu}, {klina}.

column2: $f_{1}=sj_{1}$ (du'u) is an easy to understand/clear fact/truth to $f_{2}=sj_2$  about subject $sj_{3}$ under conditions $f_{4}$.
column8: Not jvajvo, but there exist essentially no useful jvajvo definitions for this lujvo.

column2: $x1$=$j2$ is meek/[easily controlled by] $x2$=$f2$=$j1$ in activity $x3$=$j3$ under conditions $x4$=$f3$
$x_1$ (event/object) is easily spotted, obvious to observer $x_2$ with senses $x_3$, under conditions $x_4$.
column8: A safer, healthier and lujvo-er alternative to {li'armi}.

column2: $s_1$ is easily understood/interpreted as the meaning of $s_2$ by (agent) $s_3$=$f_2$ under conditions $f_3$
column8: From {frili}+{smuni}.  The $x_1$ of {frili} is subsumed into the overall sense of the word.  See also: {filseljmi}, {klina}.

column2: $t_1$=$f_2$ speaks fluently to $t_2$ about subject $t_3$ in language $t_4$ under conditions $f_3$.
$c_1$=$f_1$ is the creator deity/demiurge of people(s)/religion(s) $c_2$, having created $c_3$=$f_2$ from material/primordial chaos $f_4$.
$fr_1$=$fi_1$ dedicates invention/creation/composition/work $fr_2$=$fi_2$ to $fr_3$ with conditions $fr_4$.
$x_1$ is free and open source (not limited to software)
column5: free cultural work;free software;open content;open source

column2: $c_1$ is characterized by creativity; $c_1$ is creative/inventive (one sense).
$t_2$ is the style (in the sense of art/fashion/creative work/object) of object $f_2$ by creator $f_3$ derived from existing elements/ideas $f_4$
$x_1$=$f_1$=$xa_1$ is Afro-Asiatic in aspect $x_2$=$f_2$=$xa_2$; $x_1$ is Africa and Asia considered together
$x_1$ pertains to African-American culture in aspect $x_2$.
$f_1$=$t_1$ is Africa.
$x_1$  is an African elephant (genus Loxodonta) of species/breed $x_2$.
column8: For example, x2 could be the African bush elephant or the smaller African forest elephant. See also: {xanto}, {loksodonta} (syn.), {zdoxanto}.

column2: $xr_1$ is a guineafowl of species/breed $xr_2$
$c_1$ is a fish farm at $c_2$, farmed by $c_3$, raising/producing fish species $x_4$=$f_2$.
$fi_1$ is a gill of fish $fe_2$=$fi_1$ of species $x_3$=$fi_2$.
column8: See also {fipybirka}, {fipyrebla} for other fish-body related words.

column2: $x_1$ fishes for fish species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is March of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$ is stick-shaped fish meat [a fishstick] of fish type/species $x_2$
$x1$=$s1$ is a roe/spawn of fish $x2$=$s2$=$f2$
$x_1$ is a water moccasin.
$x_1$ is a fin (body part) of $x_2$.
$b_1$ is a fish bone, performing function $b_2$ in body of fish $b_3$.
$g_1$ is a/the fisheries industry/sector producing fish products $g_2$  from fish species $f_2$ by process $g_3$
$x_{1}$ is a tail with tailed-fish $x_{2}$.
$b_1$=$f_1$ is a facial skeleton/splanchnocranium/viscerocranium of $b_3$=$f_2$
$x_1$ pertains to Facebook in aspect $x_2$.
$x1$=$fl2$=$fr1$ has look/[facial expression] $x2$=$fl1$=$fr2$ to stimulus $x3$=$fr3$ under condition $x4$=$fr4$
$g_1$ is a mask covering the face of $g_2$=$f_2$.
$k_1$ is the beard/moustace/facial hair of $f_2$=$k_2$.
$x_1$=$v_1$ removes facial hair $x_2$=$v_2$=$k_1$ from $x_3$=$v_3$=$k_2$=$f_2$'s face
$s_2$ is face-blind, recognizing people by $s_3$ which is not the face, by standard $s_4$
$p_1$ is a silhouette of $f_1$ made by $p_3$ in medium $p_4$.
$x_1$ blushes due to stimulus $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$
$x_1$ (force) is physically strong in aspect $x_2$ by standard $x_3$
column8: {fisli}, {tsali}. Specifically refers to the physical aspect of {tsali}. Syn. {jikfytsa}

column2: $x_1$ rejects $x_2$ (offer, suggestion, proposal) from $x_3$.
$x_1$ accepts $x_2$ (an offer/suggestion) from $x_3$.
$g_1$ [person/agent] confuses $c_1$ (event/state) for $c_2$ [observer] due to [confusing] property $c_3$ (ka).
$c_1$=$f_3$ [lacks law]/[is lawless with regard to] law(s) $f_1$ specifying $f_2$ (state/event) under conditions $f_4$ by lawgiver(s) $f_5$; $c_1$=$f_3$ is lawless.
$g_1$=$t_1$ is the Lower House/House of Representatives/House of Commons for territory $t_2$ with members $g_3$=$f_5$.
column5: House of Commons;House of Representatives;Lower House

column2: $f_1$ is the legal system concerning topic $f_2$ in society $f_3$
column8: cf. {flalu}, {ciste}. Refers to "the law" as an entity, i.e. the legal system. Also used in compounds describing specific areas of law, such as lanzu flaci'e (family law) or zekri flaci'e (criminal law).

column2: $x_1$ is a lawyer
$x_1$ is lawful, legal according to law $x_2$
$x_1$ is a legal adult, according to law $x_2$
$x_1$ is a flamingo (Phoenicopterus roseus) of variety $x_2$
$t_1$ is an outlaw not following the law $t_2$ made by $t_3$.
$r_1$ is CEO (Chief Executive Officer)/MD (Managing Director) of company/corporation/firm $t_2$=$k_1$.
having property $x_1$ semantically entails having property $x_2$.
$x_1$ starts/begins to have property $x_2$
column5: begin to have property;start to have property

column2: $x_1$ transitions to state $x_2$ from state $x_3$
$x_1$ wants to be/do $x_2$ (ka) for purpose $x_3$
column8: ka-version of {djica}, that strengthens the relationship between $x_1$ and the property.

column2: $x_1$ (number) is the quantity of specimens in the domain of discourse that satisfy the property $x_2$
column8: Predicate equivalent of {da}. It enables rendering a quantifier's scope as a nested bridi level, and to terminate this scope explicitly by closing the sub-bridi. Synonymous with {dzadza}.

column2: $x_1$ is close to having property/almost has property/is/does almost $x_2$ (ka)
$x_1$ goes to (the place to) have property $x_2$
$x_1$ measures, determinates (by sensorial examination) that property $x_2$ is satisfied by $x_3$.
$x_1$ (agent) changes $x_2$ to state $x_3$ (ka) from state $x_4$ (ka).
$x_1$ chooses/selects $x_2$ from $x_3$ (set) for purpose $x_4$ (property).
column8: Under one interpretation, $cuxna_2$ must be a proposition and $cuxna_3$ must be a set of propositions, meaning cuxna is more similar to "decide". This word is equivalent to "cuxna lo du'u ckaji", and allows us to avoid implicit sumti raising with cuxna.

column2: $x_1$ is far from being $x_2$ (ka)
$x_1$ gives/confers property $x_2$ (ka) to $x_3$.
column8: Or: $x_1$ makes $x_3$ exhibit $x_2$. Essentially equal to something like {selkaigau}.

column2: $x_1$ thinks/opines that $x_2$ is/does $x_3$ (ka) under grounds $x_4$
$x_1$ considers $x_2$ to have quality $x_3$ (ka) ; $x_2$ qualifies as / counts as being $x_3$ according to $x_1$
being $x_1$ (ka) is part of being $x_2$ (ka)
column8: Or "$x_2$ implies $x_1$", but stronger than the logical sense; this word is definitional or essentialistic, and implies that if something stopped being $x_1$, it'd stop being $x_2$. See {kai'a}, {bi'ai}, {nibli}, {jinzi}

column2: $s_1$ is the concept of representative democracy (default: political representative democracy) as it applies to the governance of $t_2$ based on the works of thinker(s) $s_3$
$x_1$=$xa_1$ is an avatar/physical embodiment of property/force $x_2$=$c_2$ (ka); $x_1$ is $x_2$ incarnate.
$x_1$ needs to be/do $x_2$ (ka) for purpose $x_3$
column8: ka-version of {nitcu}, that strengthens the relationship between $x_1$ and the property.

column2: $x_1$ is a calculator / computer / reckoning machine computing $x_{2}$ [value (ni)/state] from data $x_{3}$ by process $x_{4}$
$t_1$=$k_2$ is a cupboard for storing $t_2$, made of $t_3$, with shelves $k_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a program / automaton calculating/reckoning/computing $x_{2}$ [value (ni)/state] from data $x_{3}$ by process $x_{4}$
$x_1$ is (or is made of/from) a quantity of spermaceti (spermaceti wax/oil).
$c_1$=$k_4$ is an excavator/power shovel for digging in $k_3$, operated by $k_1$=$c_3$.
$s_1$ is a sob/sobbing produced by $k_1$ with tears $k_2$ about/for reason $k_3$ (event/state).
$x_1$ is a teardrop wept by $x_2$ for reason $x_3$.
$b_1$=$k_1$ is an eyeball (body part) of $k_2$.
$x_1$ is the pupil of the eye of $x_2$
$x_1$ is the iris of the eye of $x_2$
$x_1$ is an iris of color $x_2$ as perceived by $x_3$ under viewing conditions $x_4$; $x_2$ is $x_1$'s eye color.
$x_1$'s eye(s)/iris(es) is/are hazel as perceived by $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$
column8: Hazel in this context is a brown and/or gold color that is mixed with or has a tint of green (or vice-versa). Really, only objects that have qualities similar to eye irises can be hazel; other combinations of brown and green do not necessarily constitute hazel (rather, they are often a muddy green or a mossy brown), but if the object has these qualities sufficiently, it may qualify. The point is that not all brown-greens are hazel. This color is distinct from amber.

column2: $c_1$ is a dung beetle [dung-eating arthropod] of species/breed $c_2$.
column8: A beetle (or, metaphorically, other arthropod) whose diet primarily consists of the feces of other animals.

column2: $v_1$=$k_2$ defecates/shits/poos.
$g_1$ is an eyelid of eye $k_1$=$g_2$.
$ke_1$ is an eyelash (body part) of $ke_2$=$ka_2$.
$x_1$=$k_2$=$g_1$ winks/blinks
$x_1$ is a longan berry (Dimocarpus longan) of type $x_2$
column8: See {kanla}, {jbari}. Named for superficial similarity of the peeled fruit to an eye, as paralleled by the Chinese name, 龙眼 (lóngyǎn, lit. "dragon's eye").

column2: $ke_1$ is an eyebrow (supraorbital ridge) of $ke_2$=$ka_2$=$m_2$.
$x_1$=$v_2$ is a tear/tear fluid of $x_2$=$v_1$.
$x_1$ is a surrounding cover/curtain that surrounds the eye structure of $x_2$
column8: This can include eye stalks (if the eye can be retracted into/enveloped by the surrounding tissue), etc.; it might include eye lids, although it is arguable that they do not really "surround" the eye. A purpose of the curtain must be to cover the eye, not just encase it. Essentially, this must be a circular/ringlike/sphincter eyelid.

column2: $x_1$ is an eyewear or are eyeglasses
$x_1$ hunts another which hunts another which ... which hunts another which hunts $x_2$ via intermediate steps $x_3$ (ce'o).
$v_1$=$k_2$ weeps/lacrimates tear(s) $v_2$ from $v_3$ via means/route $v_4$.
$k_1$ is the greatness/majesty/splendour/magnificence/grandeur of $b_1$ according to standard $b_3$.
$k_1$ is a security condition of $b_1$ protecting $b_2$ from threat $b_3$.
column8: When used as "security", x3 is a planned threat. "security" is comparable to "safety" ({kamnu'a}), "reliability" ({kamylacri}), and "continuity" ({kamra'i}).

column2: $k_1$ is quality/property exhibited by $b_1$ of being foolish/silly/stupid in event/action /property (ka) $b_2$.
$x_1$ is blueness
column8: This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL

column2: $x_1$=$k_1$ is the property of gratitude/thankfulness/appreciation of $x_2$=$c_2$ for $x_3$=$c_3$ (event/property)
column8: It is implicitly assumed that ce'u is assigned to ckire1.

column2: $k_1$ is $c_1$'s expertise/prowess in/skill at/mastery of $c_2$ (event/activity) by standard $c_3$
$x_1$ is the identity function/equality relation
column8: brivla form of ka ce'u du ma kau.

column2: $x_1$ is happiness experienced by $x_2$ about (event/state/idea) $x_3$
column8: Extension of $gleki_2$ to $x_3$ in order to include/accomodate idea type sumti.

column2: $x_1$ is (the quality of) luster/sheen/shininess/finish of $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$
column8: In heraldry, characterizes the distinction between tinctures (metals and colours/dyes).

column2: $x_1$ is the life (property of being alive) of $x_2$.
column8: For the event of living, see {nunji'e}.

column2: $x_1$ is a society; $x_1$ is social
$x_1$ is the cleaniness/hygiene of $x_2$
$m_1$  tests/evaluates/measures $j_1$'s knowledge of facts (du'u)  $j_2$ in subject area $j_3$  as $m_3$ units on scale $m_4$ with accuracy $m_5$
column8: The x2 through x4 places are = m2.

column2: $k_1$=$b_1$ is a vertebra of $b_3$ ; $b_3$ is a vertebrate.
$x_1$ is a leek of variety $x_2$.
$kam_1$ is the health of $kan_1$ by standard $kan_2$.
$k_1$ is the majesty of $t_1$=$n_1$ being a regent/monarch of $t_2$ by standard $n_2$.
$x_1$ is wisdom of $x_2$ on matter $x_3$

column5: the greater end;the numerically higher end
column8: For example, a Gaussian has two tails; the tail with the greater numbers (which is traditionally/conventionally plotted on the right side of a horizontally oriented scale) is kamyzmakezra'a. For another example, suprema and infima are the bounds on a set; suprema are bounds from (so-called) above - in other words, from the numerically greater side of the set in question. This word is used for every reference of saying "above", "upper", or "right" in the context of ordered numbers, since these terms are culturally-dependent. See also: {kamymeckezra'a}.

column8: $x_1$ is a space/directed graph/set of ordered n-tuples which is formed from the endowment of of a space/set (of possible nodes) $x_2$ with the relationship $x_3$ which is n-ary.  Suppose that $x_2$ is binary; let y and z be elements in $x_2$ and denote $x_3$ by "R" so that "a R b" means that R relates 'a' to 'b' in that order (not necessarily the reverse); then: if y R z, then (y,z) is an element in $x_1$. In other words, $x_1$ is the set of exactly all ordered edges between members of $x_2$ (which are nodes/endpoints of members of $x_1$), which are formed iff R relates those members in the order indicated by the direction of the edge (source then destination; first term, then second term) when R is binary. Greater arity is possible (in which case ordered n-tuples become useful and edges scale up dimensionally). $x_1$ is the set of all ordered relationships in $x_2$ formed by $x_3$. One valjvo of this word is an experimental gismu: {grafu}.

column2: In the sequence $x_1$, each nonfinal member is related to the next member by the relation $x_2$.

column5: rape;rights-harming sex;sexually harm by rape;sexually violate by rape
column8: Violated right $k_1$ (event) may be implied by x4. The harm/violation must be by sexual activity (what one would consider {gletu}) and must be sexual in nature. Need not be violent. Harm may not be physical or even psychological/mental/emotional; it need only be a 'harm to one's rights' (in other words, a violation of loi {krali}). {krali} is an experimental gismu.  The mutual symmetry of gle1 and gle2 is lost/broken by the harmer-victim relationship enforced by this word (and, specifically, xai1 and xai2=k2). See also: {glexai}, {xaigle}, {vilgle}, {glevlile}, {glevilxaigau}, {glekrali}, {glecu'akrali}, {glekralyxai}, {kralyxai}.

column8: Fluid is any flowable matter (gas, liquid, slurry, powder etc.). Cf. {jaurflevau}, {datnyfle}, {blutu'u}, {tubnu}, {pambe}, {litki}, {gapci}, {bumru}, {danmo}, {purmo}, {pulce}, {sligu}.

$x_1$ is a floating island of material/properties $x_2$ floating on $x_3$.
column8: This is possibly the funniest word in the entirety of Lojban.  See also {fulta} {daplu}.

column2: $x_1$ is foamless/unleavened.

$x_1$ calls $x_2$ on the phone.

$s_1$=$f_1$ is a smartphone for purpose $s_2$ attached to system/network $f_2$
$t_1$ talks on the phone to $t_2$ about $t_3$ in language $t_4$.
$n_1$ is an answering machine/voice mail message about $n_2$ from $n_3$ to $n_4$.
$x_1$ is interactive fiction about $x_2$
$g_1$ (person/agent) fertilises $g_2$=$f_1$ for supporting the growth/development of $x_3$=$f_2$.
$x_1$=$l_1$=$c_1$ misses out on experience $x_2$=$l_2$.
$x_1$=$t_1$ feels FOMO ("fear of missing out") about $x_2$=$t_2$; $x_1$=$t_1$ is scared of missing out on event/experience/information $x_2$=$t_2$
$c_1$=$d_1$ expresses wish to audience $c_3$=$l_1$ that he/she/it/they experience $l_2$, via expressive medium $c_4$

column8: Synonymous with {selfriske}. Not limited to the 'phenomenologist' tradition in Western philosophy.

column2: $fru_1$=$fra_1$ frowns/grimaces at/in reaction to $fra_3$.
$c_1$ blames/holds responsible/accuses $f_1$ for action/state $f_2$ from authority $f_3$ to audience $c_3$ with expression medium  $c_4$.

column2: $x_1$=$v_1$=$f_1$ is a loanword meaning $x_2$=$v_2$ in language $x_3$=$v_3$, based on word $x_4$=$f_2$ in language $x_5$.
column8: Also officialy used to describe words in the Lojban morphological class allocated for use by {vonfu'ivla}. Due to not being {jbosarxe} {zi'evla} is prefered by some. See also {pavyfu'ivla}, {relfu'ivla}, {cibyfu'ivla}, {vonfu'ivla}, {zi'evla}, {le'avla}.

column2: $f_4$=$p_1$ pastes (during editing) $f_2$=$p_2$ from $f_3$.
$f_4$=$r_1$ copies (during editing) $f_2$=$r_2$ from $f_3$.
$c_1$=$s_2$ is a mockingbird of species $c_2$ which produces sound $s_1$ that is a copy of $f_2$.
$f_1$=$s_1$ responds to $f_2$=$s_2$ with response $s_3$=$f_4$, which is roughly the same thing.
column8: Responding with mimicry; this might mean repeating their words, or returning a favor with a similar favor, etc.

column2: $x_1$ mimics or imitates $x_2$ in doing $x_3$; $x_1$ copies $x_2$'s actions or behavior
$x_1$ is the vector flux (flow) of quantity/substance (count) $x_2$ through (geometric/imaginary) hypersurface/embedded manifold $x_3$ per unit hyperarea per unit time.
column8: This is the transport phenomena sense of "flux": a density of flow, the maximal rate of flow of a subsramce or quantity ($x_2$) through a differential hypersurface. If the hypersurface $x_3$ is $n$-dimensional spatially and the dimensionality (units) of $x_2$ is $U$, then the dimensionality (units) of $x_1$ is $U$/(1 m$^{n}$ * s). Fairly similar to {nildenmi}. For the hypersurface integral of this quantity (with respect to the normal), use: {flaumji}. See also: {flecu}.

column2: $x_1$ is a plum of variety $x_2$.

$x_1$ is the scalar flux (total flow) of quantity/substance $x_2$ through bounding Jordan orientable manifold $x_3$ under conditions and conventions of definition $x_4$ (including actual orientation of $x_3$, signum of outflux, etc.)
column8: This is the hypersurface integral sense "flux". For the sense of the integrand which produces this meaning, use {flaukse}. See also: {flecu}, {nildenmi}.

column2: $x_1$ (property of $x_3$) is the grammar of language $x_2$ for elidible construct $x_3$ that is assumed to fill its place even if elided
$x_1$ is a flounder of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ represents/pertains to Canaan/Phoenician culture in property/aspect $x_2$
$x_1$ is a pangolin of species/breed $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a formal expression; $x_1$ is formal
$x_1$ is a format, layout of a publication or document $x_2$
$x_1$ has a pleasing shape, is pleasant to look at by $x_2$
$x_1$ is a fortepiano
$x_1$ is a strawberry of species/breed $x_2$.
$x_1$ is an ash of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a fractal with properties $x_2$
column8: Fractal is a geometric figure that repeats itself under several levels of magnification, and that shows self-similarity on all scales. See also {pixra}, {cartu}, {panra}, {ckilu}

column2: $x_1$ is a blackberry/raspberry/bramble of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a buckthorn of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a document used to prepay service $x_2$ like postage costs, tax, license fees; $x_1$ is a postage stamp used to pay service $x_2$
$x_1$ reflects/relates to/pertains to Gothic (French-originating, High or Late Medieval, post-Romanesque pre-Renaissance) style/aesthetic/art/architecture/practice in aspect $x_2$
column8: Probably not restricted to pieces from the original time period, as long as it relates to the style in some way. Does not refer to the various Goths peoples in a contemporaneous manner, nor to the 'emo/goth' style (dark clothes, etc.).

column2: $x_1$ (text) is an example of witticism, quip about $x_2$ by $x_3$
$x_1$ is a quantity of dark matter/dark gravitation [unknown thing with gravitational consequences] with properties $x_2$
column8: If scientists eventually figure out that dark matter is not a thing at all but, for example, the result of a mathematical correction to our present understanding of gravitation, this word may need to be redefined to something similar to "$x_1$ relates to dark matter/dark gravitation in manner/aspect $x_2$", or whatsoever is fitting, or it could be deleted all together.

column2: $x_1$ is a fresco
$x1$ pertains to the Fertile Crescent region/geography/nationality/culture/history in property/aspect $x2$
$x_1$ and $x_2$ are in relation $x_3$ with different things (i.e. not the same things).
$x_1$ is a boiled meatball (meal; a ball of minced or ground meat, boiled) consisting of $x_2$
column8: {polpeta} is a more generic term. See also {tefteli}, {sanmi}, {rectu}

column2: $x_1$ is a fricassee, pieces of chicken or other meat stewed in gravy with e.g. carrots and onions and served with noodles or dumplings
$x_1$ (an artiodactyl, usually a bovine) is intersex because of an opposite-sex twin; $x_1$ is a freemartin
$x_1$ experiencing $x_2$ is prevented by $x_3$; $x_1$ misses (one sense) $x_2$
$x_1$ is a friterie / baraque à frites / friture / frituur / frietkot / frietkraam serving fast food $x_2$ to $x_3$.
column8: A particular type of fast food restaurant, selling fries and usually a variety of other deep-fried snacks and sauces, as found in Belgium, the Netherlands and Northern France. The place structure models {gusta}.

column2: $x_1$ is a frustum/cone/cylinder/pyramid made of material $x_2$ with larger base $x_3$ and at-most-as-large base $x_4$, with other characteristics $x_5$.
column8: $x_4$ cannot be larger in hyperarea than $x_3$. A cone and a pyramid are degenerate frusta with exactly one base ($x_4$) being exactly a point (the apex); a line segment is a doubly-degenerate frustum with $x_3$ (and therefore $x_4$) being a point. The bases should typically be approximately parallel to one another; they need not be perpendicular to their axis. Except possibly when at least one base is a point, they will be (apprpximately) geometrically similar to one another (having the same cross-section along parallel planes wrt the axis, modulo scale/size, which will nonetheless be multiplied by a uniform factor in all 'dimensions'). A round base will produce, approximately, a circular cone or a (circular) cylinder.

column2: $x_1$ is a bandersnatch of species $x_2$
fnord
Franz Kafka
synonym of {ba'e}

Creates a predicate abstraction sumti out of a full bridi clause, binding all the necessary lambda variables to the ko'a-ko'u pronoun series. The number of bound variables must be indicated by appending {xi} followed by that number to the word {fo'ai}, unless only one variable (namely {fo'a}) is bound, in which case the {xi} marking is optional.
column8: lo ka ce'u ce'u ce'u broda (ku) = "fo'ai xi ci fo'a fo'e fo'i broda (ku'au)". In the rare cases where more than five lambda variables are needed, fo'a xi PA might be used. See also ko'ai, ce'ai.

column2: GOI attachment modifier: allows a cmavo of selma'o GOI (which must follow immediately) to be attached to a selbri
column8: This word must (ignoring quotes, etc.) be preceded by a selbri (to which it immediately attaches, even in sumti) and must be followed by a member of selma'o GOI (ignoring erasure, etc.). All other semantics and syntax of the GOI construct remains the same, it just applies to the selbri immediately prior to this word, rather than a sumti. See also: {po'oi}.

column2: create a relation abstraction sumti out of a full bridi clause, binding the two lambda variables to the {fo'i} and {fo'u} pronouns.
digit/number: first Foias' constant; the unique value of $x_1$ such that $x_n$  -> ∞ as n -> ∞ for $x_{n+1}  = (1 + (1/( x_n )))^n$; such $x_1$ = 1.187…
digit/number: second Foias constant; the value x for which $(1/x)(1 + (1/x))^x=1$ is true; ≈ 2.293…

discursive: 
{fu'au} - luckily
{fu'aucu'i} - not pertaining to luck
{fu'aunai} - unluckily.
column8: Expresses fortune/misfortune of the speaker. Use {dai} to express fortune/misfortune of the listener. See also {funca}.

column2: begin within-context quote.
column8: Terminated by {fu'o}. Quoted text need not be grammatical on its own, but must be grammatical in context with the surrounding text.

column2: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'a; used generally in quotations.
column8: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

column2: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'e; used generally in quotations.
column8: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

column2: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'i; used generally in quotations.
column8: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

column2: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'o; used generally in quotations.
column8: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

column2: discursive: indicate a change in speaker to fo'u; used generally in quotations.
column8: Considered to have sa'a attached to it by default. Using sa'anai would cancel that effect. Used to quote dialogues.

column2: $x_1$ is a fortepiano
attitudinal modifier: \n{fu'i } - easy\n{fu'i nai} - difficult.
$x_{1}$ (passive) floats on/in fluid (gas/liquid) $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is buoyant.
$x_{1}$ (event/property) is determined by the luck/fortune of $x_{2}$; (note mabla/zabna not implied). $x_{1}$ is determined by chance.
$x_{1}$ rots/decays/ferments with decay/fermentation agent $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is rotten/decayed/fermented.
$x_{1}$ is responsible/accountable for $x_{2}$ (action/resulting state) to judge/authority $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cover/[lid/top] for covering/concealing/sheltering $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an article/descriptor labelling description $x_{2}$ (text) in language $x_{3}$ with semantics $x_{4}$.
column8: $x_2$ is the noun phrase/sumti without the article/descriptor; description (($x_1$ with $x_2$) = gadysu'i); note: 'determiner' has become the accepted general linguistics term, displacing 'article'; however, 'determiner' includes all words that can introduce a noun phrase/sumti, whether a description or not, such as pronoun possessives like lemi, quantifiers (especially in indefinites) like ci and su'o, and demonstratives like ti, ta, and tu; the term 'descriptor' in Lojban, is limited to words that introduce descriptions (excluding indefinites), such as those of selma'o LA and LE, their common compounds such as lemi, and possibly lenu.  'article' typically refers only to a single word; Lojban assumes the broader meaning] See also {valsi}, {cmavo}.

column2: end indicator long scope; terminates scope of all active indicators.
n-ary mathematical operator: elliptical/unspecified mathematical expression (mex) operator.
letteral for f.
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal or (with gi).
{zgana} modal, 1st place                            to observer ... ; witnessed by ...
upper-case letteral shift.

attitudinal modifier/honorific: 
{ga'i} - hauteur; used with one of lower rank.
{ga'icu'i} - equal rank
{ga'inai} - meekness
digit/number: hex digit C (decimal 12) [twelve].
$x_1$ is a loanword meaning $x_2$ in language $x_3$, based on word $x_4$ in language $x_5$.
$g_1$ (agent) creates copy $f_1$ of $f_2$ in form/medium $f_3$ by method $f_4$ (event).
$x_1$ is a copy/clone of a copy/clone of ... a copy/clone of $x_2$ through intermediate steps $x_3$ (ce'o).
$r_1$ is the rafsi prefix used in stage-3 fu'ivla $v_1$=$f_1$, rafsi based on word $r_2$.
column8: “rafsi prefix” is a term specific to Lojban and refers to the initial part of a stage-3 fu'ivla which is a rafsi. $x_2$ is the word in which the rafsi is used, $x_3$ is the word from which the rafsi has been derived. See also: {cibyfu'ivla}, {fu'ivla}, {rafsi}.

column2: $f_1$=$z_1$=$p_1$ holds the copyright for copying $f_2$=$p_2$ under law $p_3$.
column8: Copyright itself might be "si'o fukzifypo'e". If you are actually translating something with a copyright notice, you should leave the notice in the original language.

column2: $t_1$=$f_1$ is a raft of material $t_2$ shape $t_3$ floating on $f_2$.
$j_1$ decides/makes a decision $j_2$ (du'u) about $j_3$, whose outcome is determined by luck.
$x_1$ is compost.
$sa_1$ is fish sauce for use with $sa_2$, containing ingredients including $sa_3$.
$x_1$=$g1$=$j1$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains stainless steel
$f_1$=$p_1$ is fermented bean paste of soybeans $s_1$=$p_2$.
column8: Fermented bean paste is a category of fermented foods typically made from ground soybeans, which are indigenous to the cuisines of East and Southeast Asia, such as miso.

column2: $x_1$ rusts
$t_1$=$f_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of rust.

$k_1$=$t_1$=$f_1$ is the board of directors/trustees of  $k_3$.
column5: board;board of directors;Board of Directors;board of trustees

column2: $x_1$ holds $x_2$ responsible for $x_3$ (event/action)
$b_1$ is a broom with bristles $b_2$ with long handle $g_1$.
$j_1$ plays baseball against $j_2$ in competition $j_3$ for prize/title $j_4$.
$co_1$ is a mop/swab/swob for soaking up $ci_1$=$co_2$ with long handle $g_1$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) pole dances to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$ using pole $g_1$.
$x_1$ is a truss for supporting $x_2$
$x_1$ is truss bridge a over/across $x_2$ between $x_3$ and $x_4$
$x_1$ is a popsicle with ice cream $x_2$=$b_1$=$l_1$ and stick $x_3$=$g_1$.
$x_1$ is a french-fried potato of variety/cultivar $x_2$ cooked in fat/oil $x_3$
$v_1$ is a grate between $v_2$ and $v_3$ of material $g_2$=$x_4$.
$b_1$ is a gas cylinder [closable container for gas] made of material $b_3$ with lid $b_4$.
$x_1$=$d_1$=$g_2$ desublimates from the gaseous state at temperature $x_2$=$d_2$=$g_3$ with pressure $x_3$=$d_3$.
column8: The process of this is called “deposition” or “desublimation” in English. From “{gapci} {dunja}”; refers to a direct change of the state of matter from gaseous to solid. Cf. {ligyfebvi}.

column2: $g_1$=$z_1$ perceives $z_2$ to have quality $g_2$ by means/sense $g_3$=$z_3$ under conditions $g_4$=$z_4$
$x_1 = cuxna_3$ (set) is the collection of options/settings that can be chosen by user $x_2 = cuxna_1$ ~ $galfi_1$ for purpose $x_3$.
column8: cuxna2 is deleted; galfi1 was raised from an event abstraction to a person agent; the third sumti slot of this word is not predictable from veljvo (but is inspired by galfi2). x3 is the interface feature which the choices modify; for example, x3 can be the sound amplitude ('loudness') feature/setting on a speaker and x1 is a set of values for that feature (according to some scale) which can be achieved by the speaker output.

column2: $x_1$ (agent) causes $x_2$ (event) to modify/alter/change/transform/convert $x_3$ into $x_4$
column8: This is a {jvajvo}: {galfi} {zei} {gasnu}. Included in the dictionary because it's referenced in the notes for {galfi}.

column2: $x_1$=$z_1$=$g_1$ is a zmico that modifies the terbri default specification of a brivla, producing result $x_2$=$z_2$=$g_3$ at level/with construct-orientation $x_3$=$z_3$ with discourse duration $x_4$=$z_4$ in language $x_5$=$z_5$; $x_1$ is a default specification modifier that produces output re-specification $x_2$
column8: {zmico} is an experimental gismu. See also: {zmico}, {sumyzmico}

column2: $m_1$=$g_1$ is a cover/[lid/top] for sheltering $m_2$=$g_2$ from danger/threat $m_3$.
$x_1$ is a voiceless labiodental fricative sound produced by $x_2$.
column5: F sound;voiceless labiodental fricative;voiceless labiodental fricative sound

column2: $x_1$ (la'e zo BY/word-bu) is a capital/capitalised/upper-shift letter/digit/symbol in alphabet/character-set $x_2$ representing $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a ferret (Mustela putorius furo) of the breed $x_2$
$x_1$ is a hazel (nut/tree) of species $x_2$
$x_1$ is a part of Lojban text representing rule 'operator' according to the first edition of the book 'The Complete Lojban Language'.
column8: Inner structure of the rule: operator-1 (joik-jek operator-1 | joik stag? KE # operator /KEhE#/)*. For the description of the syntax see {jarnezi}.

column2: $x_1$ (plural of ordered pairs) is an exhaustive set (possibly infinite) of inputs/outputs defining a unary function which yields result $x_3$ when given input $x_2$; $x_1$($x_2$) = $x_3$
column8: f(x) = z == "fy funtiio xy fi zy". "lo ro se {zilbri} be lo ka ce'u {sumji} ce'u li pa" is a way to extract the input/output set of the relation "f(x) = x−1", so that you can use it as funtiio's x1. Using a la-name for referring to a function is also an option, for example "la .fankcyn. cu funtiio li re li ci". See also {fancu}, {fancuka}.

column2: $x_1$ is dandruff in/on $x_2$ caused by $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a furcula/wishbone/merrythought/fused clavicle (body part) of $x_2$.
$x_1$ rusts
$x_1$ (la'e zo BY/word-bu) is a capital/capitalised/upper-shift letter/digit/symbol in alphabet/character-set $x_2$ representing $x_3$.
$x_1$ (ka) is the case (uppercase or lowercase) of letter $x_2$ in orthography $x_3$
digit/number: twenty-one (decimal 21).

Number suffix initiating a subordinate clause representing a predicate whose arity is the suffixed number; the lambda variables representing the predicate slots are bound from the fo'a-fo'u series in their dictionary ordering; the number of bound variables is the same as the predicate arity.
column8: For example, if the selected arity is two (re fy'oi), then only {fo'a} and {fo'e} are bound, and {fo'i} etc. are not bound. Terminator: {ku'au}.

column2: unary mekso operator: Lorentz-Einstein gamma factor $+1/((1-(|X|^2))^{(+1/2)})$ for input $X$.
column8: Typically, input X can be a scalar (typically between -1 and 1, exclusive of both endpoints except in the limit) or a vector (or a similar mathematical object) with a signed magnitude belonging to the previously mentioned interval; in the former case, "|X|" in the definition refers to its absolute value; in the latter case, "|X|" in the definition refers to the nonnegative magnitude of said vector (or similar object). Typically, the output is a(n extended) real number no less than 1; whether or not positive-infinity exists in the codomain is a matter of convenience, convention, and context. This definition can be extended (such as for tachyons).

column2: digit/number: Euler–Mascheroni constant, usually denoted by lowercase gamma (γ); approximately 0.5772156649 (in decimal).
column8: The difference in the limit as n becomes arbitrarily large between/of: the sum of (1/k) for all strictly positive integers k < (n+1), and the natural logarithm of n.

column2: abstractor: sensation / qualia abstractor; $x_1$ is the sensation / qualia associated with objects with property [bridi, bound to ce'u], via sense $x_2$, as sensed by $x_3$
column8: Semantically linked to {ganseti}. {lo} {ga'ei} ({ce'u}) {xunre} = {lo} {ganseti} {be} {lo} {ka} ({ce'u}) {xunre}. Is one proposed way of dealing with abstractions of colors ({zilska}) and other "elemental" sense experiences. Proposed rafsi: -gel-

column2:
attitudinal modifier/honorific: 
{ga'i } - hauteur
{ga'i cu'i} - equal rank; used with one of equal rank.
{ga'i nai} - meekness
zgadi/cadga modal; 1st place: with just/expected result ...; should/ought to result in ...
column8: Not necessarily causal; may be hypothetical.

column2:
attitudinal modifier/honorific: 
{ga'i } - hauteur
{ga'i cu'i} - equal rank
{ga'i nai} - meekness; used with one of higher rank.
$x_{1}$ (event) modifies/alters/changes/transforms/converts $x_{2}$ into $x_{3}$.
column8: Causal, resultative change; agentive modification (= {gafygau}, {gafyzu'e}).  (cf. {stika} for non-resultative, {binxo} for not-necessarily causal change, {cenba} for non-resultative change; {zasni})

column2: $x_{1}$ is high/up/upward in frame of reference $x_{2}$ as compared with baseline/standard height $x_{3}$.
column8: Also upper; $x_3$ is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself.  See also {gapru}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {drudi}, {farna}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the throat/gullet [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: narrow(ing) opening of a deep hole].
$x_{1}$ (portal/passage/entrance-way) is closed/shut/not open, preventing passage/access to $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$ (something being blocked).
column8: As a doorway, but also perhaps a semi-permeable membrane. $x_{3}$ is blocked by $x_{1}$. $x_{2}$ is inaccessible. See also {kalri}, {pagre}, {canko}, {vorme}, {zunti}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is broad/wide in dimension $x_{2}$ [2nd most significant dimension] by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [observer] senses/detects/notices stimulus $x_{2}$ (object/nu) by means $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.
column8: $x_1$ is sensitive to $x_2$; also feels, spots, perceives, makes out, discerns/recognizes (but only implying reaction without necessarily any significant mental processing); note that the emphasis is on a property which stimulates $x_1$ and is detected (sanji is passive about the sensing, and is not limited to sensory input, as well as presuming some kind of discernment/recognition, while not being concerned with the means of detection); $x_3$ sense/sensory channel.  See also {pencu}, {sanji}, {viska}, {sumne}, {tirna}, {zgana}, {canci}, {simlu}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is a/the testes/ovary/testicle/scrotum/balls/gonad/stamen/pistil [body-part] of $x_{2}$, gender $x_{3}$.

column8: Also asshole/ass/arsehole; (adjective:) $x_1$ is anal.  See also {zargu}, {kalci}, {mabla}, {rinci}.

column2: $x_{1}$ organizes $x_{2}$ [relative chaos] into $x_{3}$ [ordered/organized result] by system/principle(s) $x_{4}$.
column8: $x_3$ is also a system; $x_4$ could be merely a function which inherently serves to dictate the organizational structure of $x_3$.  See also {ciste}, {morna}, {stura}, {bilni}, {cabra}.

column2: $x_{1}$ is gaseous/fumes/a gas/vapor of material/composition including $x_{2}$, under conditions $x_{3}$.
column8: $x_3$ includes temperature and pressure.  See also {pambe}, {vacri}, {litki}, {sligu}, {danmo}, {bumru}, {cidro}, {flecu}.

See also {jakto'a} for "high-pitched".\n\n"wide" refers to the wavelength of a note low in frequency, as well as the characteristics of an object which produces such a note. Alternative to existing word {cmato'a}, which is ambiguous due to the fact that "small" could refer to either the frequency in Hertz (i.e., low pitch) or the wavelength (i.e. high pitch).

column8: r2 is assumed to be indefinite (indehiscent fruit must be processed/stimulated by active external means in order to release their seeds). There is no reason for the 'fruit' to necessarily be of a plant, although it probably will be.

$x_1$ (text, image, page element) is supra/aforementioned/previous/earlier/preceding/above/toward the top of the page/screen (flat and primarily two-dimensional display) relative to $x_2$ (text, image, page element) on page/screen/in work $x_3$ according to cultural convention $x_4$.
column8: Because text is usually read horizontally, this word could mean "to the left of" (for left-to-right writing) or "to the right of" (for right-to-left writing), as assessed on each given line; additionally, any horizontal direction within the plane of the display can contribute a nonzero component, so long as $x_1$ is also topward of $x_2$. For texts/writing systems which begin at the bottom of a page (according to physical orientation), then this word refers to that direction instead of the physical top of the page. In other words, this word always is oriented back along the writing/display which, by cultural convention, the user should have already consumed. Can refer to distinct prior pages. Essentially, the entire document is imagined as being displayed upon a single, arbitrarily-long, ordered screen which is wide enough to display at most a single word/character or element per line throughout; in this configuration, $x_1$ precedes and is perforce 'above' $x_2$. See also: "{balvidzita}" (opposite), "{galprurci zei farna}".

column2: $x_1$ works hard / strives / endures / does their best at / gives their all in doing $x_2$ (activity), to achieve goal $x_3$

See also {ga'ei}, {ganse}, {li'i}, {li'imdu}, {gansetifri}

mekso (no-more-than-4-ary) operator: Gaussian function $f(x, a, b, c) = c e^{-((x-a)^2 / (2*b^2))}$.
column8: Parameter 'a' is the SECOND operand; x is the first. Defaults: $c = 1/ \sqrt{2 \pi \sigma}$ (normalized), $a = \mu$ (the arithmetic average of the data set), $b = \sigma$ (the standard deviation of the data set). Moreover, by context, $\mu = 0$ (the average is 0) or $\sigma = 1$ (the standard deviation is 1) might be assumed by default.

column2: mekso n-ary operator: append contravariant (upper) indices to tensor
column8: Terminated by {te'oi'oi}. Takes ordered input (A, X_1, X_2, …, X_(n-1)), where A is a tensor and X_i is an index with an understood (or elsewhere defined) ordered domain. It appends/assigns X_i to be the ith contravariant index of A, which is usually designated as a superscript in the ith position to the right of A. See also: {ni'a'au}. It is probable that Einstein summation notation will be conventionally in effect.

column8: The x2 is not necessarily a 'base' noun, and could be any form of the same noun. See also {sumtcita}, {selbri}

column2: metasyntactic variable prenex
column8: Explicitly marks variables, e.g. ko'a ko'e, lerfu-strings, and/or brodV (must be converted into sumti using {me'ei}) as being metasyntactic: i.e. having no specific meaning or referent and merely used to demonstrate syntax or hypothetical scenarios. Automatically unassigns these variables from any previous assignment. e.g. (me'ei broda me'ei brode ko'a ko'e fo'a fo'e ge'ai). See {ge'ei}, {ce'ai}, {ke'au}, {zo'u}, {da'o}

column2: metasyntactic variable marker
column8: Explicitly marks the preceding variable, e.g. ko'a ko'e, lerfu-strings, and/or {broda} series as being metasyntactic: i.e. having no specific meaning or referent and merely used to demonstrate syntax or hypothetical scenarios. Automatically unassigns the variable from any previous assignment. May also be used for pronouns like {mi} or {do} or {dei}. This is useful to refer to {mi} as a 'first-person pronoun' rather than the actual speaker themself, for example, when giving the definition of {mi'o}: '{mi} {ge'ei} {jo'u} {do} {ge'ei}', makes it clear that the speaker doesn't literally mean the speaker and the listener, but are using {mi} and {do} metasyntactically. Similarly, one might define {mi} as '{lo} {cusku} {be} {dei} {ge'ei}'. See {ge'ai}, {da'o}

column2: mekso 7-ary operator: for input $(X_1 = z, X_2 = (a_i)_i, X_3 = (b_j)_j, X_4 = p, X_5 = q, X_6 = h_1, X_7 = h_2)$, this word/function outputs/yields $\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} (((\prod_{i = 1}^{p} ($ne'o'o$(a_i,n,1,h_1)))/(\prod_{j = 1}^{q} ($ne'o'o$(b_j,n,1,h_2)))) z^n/(n!))$; by default, $X_6 = 1 = X_7$ unless explicitly specified otherwise.
column8: See "{ne'o'o}" (Pochhammer symbol); however, for the purposes of this definition and regardless of the definition(s) provided at "ne'o'o", here ne'e'o$(Y_1, Y_2, Y_3, Y_4) = \prod_{k = 0}^{Y_2 - 1} (Y_1 + (-1)^{(1 - Y_3)} Y_4 k)$ by local definition; ne'o'o$(Y_1, Y_2, Y_3, Y_4) = 1$ for all $Y_2 < 1$, regardless of the other inputs $Y_m$ (so long as they belong to the domain); by default, $Y_4 = 1$ unless explicitly defined otherwise. For the main definition: $z$ is a complex number, and $(a_i)_i$ and $(b_j)_j$ are (pre)defined sequences (id est: functions with domains being exactly the set of exactly all positive integers) such that, for all positive integer indices $i$ and $j$ respectively, their terms/outputs are complex numbers; both $(a_i)_i$ and $(b_j)_j$ are indexed starting at $1$; also, $p, q, h_1, h_2$ are positive integers; by default, $h_1 = 1 = h_2$ unless explicitly specified otherwise. $X_2$ and $X_3$ may require usage of "{mau'au}" and "{zai'ai}".

See also {jitro}, {ralju}, {sazri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {fukpi}, {morna}.
